-Hs3Jew-rJo3J7KXaAnb7g.text: It seemed that The Yard had some changes in the kitchen and the menu- and not for the good. They changed the traditional sweet potato fries to waffle fries and they were flimsy and greasy. In fact, the "battered" French fries were not battered and again were limp and slimy. My caprese grilled cheese didn't have enough filling to cover the entire sandwich and the bread didn't have any toasted color to it, it seemed like just stale white bread. After I complained about it the waitress told me everything looked normal. The tomato soup was too thick and tart. The food on this visit is nothing like I've had during several different times doing here over the past year.  I'm not sure if there was a change in staff, management, or everyone is just getting lazy. Disappointing.

451jnKGl5yTgE7XoHhf0Yw.text: We have been here numerous times, and have never been disappointed. Always a wide range of beers and ciders, as well as yummy grilled cheese options. Mike D was our server tonight, and he was excellent! Super friendly and was giving us suggestions on what to try. Highly recommend!

_iRTAKeljwRt2wZJcfLGrQ.text: My friend and I had been meaning to check out The Yard all summer, since she's a huge grilled cheese fan and I can never get enough beer. We made it here last Monday and had a really nice experience overall. There were a few minor hiccups, but nothing to keep me from coming back again.  We came in just after happy hour had ended and were given a reasonable half hour wait time by the friendly hostess. After some window shopping on Walnut Street for around twenty minutes, we received a call from her that our table was ready. Our server approached us quickly and passed out some menus. The Yard has a large food and drinks menu, but it's laid out nicely and the beer list is particularly well-organized. I noticed that there was a Monday night special for $1 off all craft beer bottles, so I turned my attention to the bottle list. Our server came back suddenly and asked if we had "At least decided on some drinks yet"...it had been about five minutes and I felt terrible for holding him up if that's how he perceived it, so I immediately placed an order for a drink and gave him my food order as well so as not to waste his time. Now it almost certainly was just poor word choice on his part, but I was sort of taken aback to be addressed that way as I had never meant to take too long while reading the menu. (I pride myself on studying the menu online if it's available before I get to a new restaurant so I'm not holding anyone up.) It was only a small bit of unpleasantness though, and it quickly passed as we waited in such a delicious-smelling environment.   My beer arrived first with a severely broken glass, so unfortunately I had to request a replacement. The longer we were there the busier it seemed to get, so that was totally understandable. Thankfully I don't believe the food runner cut himself on it. Our food came soon after, and it was hot and fresh! Everything was plated attractively (a plus in my book) and it tasted just as great as it looked. I had the yard burger and my roommate had a grilled cheese and tomato soup. We both got sweet potato waffle fries, and based on those I would gladly try the other varieties of fries on offer! I appreciated that the burger was garnished with mixed greens rather than iceberg, and the bacon on top was of a higher quality than the typical bacon on burgers in Pittsburgh. I had planned on eating half and saving half for my lunch the following day, but everything was too delicious not to eat at once. My friend said the same thing about her grilled cheese, and since she's a fairly picky eater that's high praise from her.   When our checks came I saw that I hadn't been given the $1 off special for my craft beer bottle, but I decided not to make a huge deal about it since everything was still pretty busy around us. If I don't get any applicable discounts the next time I come I'll say something, but for the first time I'm willing to let it slide since the food was well worth it. I'd like to give The Yard 3.5 stars, but Yelp won't let me. I'll upgrade to a 4-star rating if I come back and the service and discount application improves just a bit.

pfEBu3KA07pzS4JOs3yObQ.text: Had lunch here before a Penguin's game on Saturday.  Started with the sweet Thai chili wings, extra crispy.  Followed that with the steak lettuce wraps which were fantastic.  Washed everything down with a few of the several dozen craft drafts.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak lettuce wrappers...

CjiZM4XMXvknf0jJjhKN-Q.text: If you're in the area the brunch is amazing. Bottomless mimosas and grilled cheese definitely can't be beat. Loved loved loved it!

E5atVThtqxXOCxRLTxm6Gw.text: The Yard is definitely worth a visit if you're in the Shadyside area! Especially if you're in the mood for grilled cheese! They have a bunch of different kinds and at this point I have tried the Afternoon Delight, the Jerk and most recently the Fried Green Tomato!  Also, with happy hours that feature $3 glasses of house wine and $1 of all drafts, coming alone for that is almost enough.   Definitely worth a visit! They have a great veggie burger as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Green Tomato grilled cheese, parm fries and $3 glass of Pinot Noir house wine.. YUM. (Would suggest the Cajun fries)

s2W0Xnerbujv_cKL57JnOw.text: BEST START TO A SATURDAY!! Me and 10 of my friends went to The Yard for Saturday Brunch, and we discovered the greatest place to kickoff a Saturday!!!  We were greeted by a beautiful young lady at the hostess stand who sat us promptly. Then we got to meet one of the BEST SERVERS we've ever encountered. MIKE D!!! If you go to The Yard REQUEST MIKE D's section!!! He is the most sociable server ever!! Great suggestions, funny, and he made our experience a huge success!! Mike kept our glasses full, and kept us laughing!!!  Food wise the crew was split... 5 People got the Chicken and Waffles, and nobody was disappointed!!! Others loved Mac and Cheeses and other brunch items!!  This was a great success!! The Yard was a great call and we'll be back ASAP!!! Go See Mike D!!!

JBuX2eDdJROIDY15TtP_9A.text: Unique take on grilled cheese (had the fried green tomatoes sandwich--delish!) and generous craft beer options. Enjoyed the atmosphere and service was good.

up-Y4B7IajCOD-bWZc82Dg.text: The atmosphere is almost non-existent and food was below average. The bright spots were the service (really great) and the sliders, which were tasty. My grilled cheese was The Big Che-bowski. It was entirely underwhelming. First, to me what's great about a grilled cheese is buttery bread and melty cheese - I should have noted in other's posts that these are TOASTED cheese sandwiches so the bread is dry. Dipping it in the soup helped. The saddest parts of my sandwich were the two skinny slices of bacon that were criss-crossed on it (so 60% of the sandwich was bacon-free) and the wan, almost winter-white paper thin tomatoes (really? In August you have to TRY to find such poor product). The Thunder-Buddies dessert was NOT a grilled cheese, so I am still at a loss as to why that's what it was called.

9fZ1hfr4FLmfjZLmwKcopw.text: Saddest brunch I've ever had. Ordered chorizo scramble with no onions, got onions. Happens to me all the time when i go out and I just assumed it was premade with the pico and rolled with it. However my date and her friend ordered chicken and waffles, this is where it was basically bad to worse. Starting off with the 3 saddest pieces of chicken I've ever seen. One girl actually offered the other some of her chicken but she really didn't have much to give. Worst part was when my date reached her last bite to find what looked like carpet fiber. Mortified obviously because who knows what she DIDNT see. The food also took forever but the waitress was nice. Probably won't be going back, $65 for that experience just doesn't cut it. Manager or whoever just kinda shrugged it off which compelled me to write this. Douche.

eJRbnrfr7hnP0TVmHTfxDg.text: Being from out of town we wanted something off the beat and path. The atmosphere was a mix crowd of people. I ordered the jerk grilled cheese. I expected it to have like a jerk seasoned pork, or something a bit more spicy. The apple chutney with the spicy slaw was a weird combo. The tomato soup was very much like Pizza sauce. And the chips were crunchy, but had no flavor or salt. My husband got the steak salad. Steak was cooked right, but very stringy. It was mediocre.

Guj5tbWEPDQYfrU_Y8AbQA.text: Updating my review because I went there last week and they changed it so you have to pay $1 for fries when it previously came with your sandwich for free. Also I got literally one spoonful of soup-much less than the bowlful that I usually get. The fries were burnt and too crunchy and our waitress forgot to season them? Not worth the dollar that I am now being forced to pay. The sandwiches have also gotten smaller too, I would always get the mac attack and mac and cheese would be falling out of the sandwich but now there was barely enough? I was still hungry afterwards! It may have had to do with the fact that I went on a Monday night which is when the grilled cheeses are half off but that is no excuse for such decrease in quality.

jTpZ-f9FeFAcjP2p9OTUpw.text: I love this place, I have been to this location (three times) as well as the one in Market Square in downtown Pittsburgh.Each time I enjoyed it. The prices are sort of high but it is worth it because the food is great.   They have multiple food options such as an assortment of grilled cheese, burgers, flatbread sandwiches and salads. For the sides you can choose from a selection of different fries, tomato soup, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, a veggie of the day or fruit. They also have a big drink and beer selection.   At this location I've had the crabby patty and the cheesy capresey, each time with the tomato soup and the sweet potato fries.  When you order the sweet potato fries, they come with a side of cinnamon butter to dip them in. I would highly recommend this place for lunch, a dinner get together, or a date.   In the late morning to mid afternoon they also serve brunch. I have never been there for brunch but have heard that they are really good (plus they serve mimosas!)

lI80sTFRpcyN_G0coHHkBA.text: I loved my first experience at the Yard. A friend and I decided to stop by after work on a week night. It was nice to see that it is fairly busy even on a Wednesday. We went during happy hour. The beer list is very extensive so if you like beer, you're sure to find something to suit your tastes. I was tempted by the $5 drink of the day, an "adult cherry coke" but went with a beer instead.  Our waiter was extremely pleasant and super helpful when it came to choosing from the menu. I was between a few different grilled cheeses and asked him for a recommendation. He said the Big Chew-bowski was his favorite out of my few options, so I went with that. I also got the sweet potato fries. They came with this delicious cinnamon flavored dip.   My grilled cheese was spectacular. I've never had a gourmet grilled cheese before. I definitely want to go back to try a few of the other ones. The only thing that was just okay was the tomato soup. Like other people have said, it just seems like condensed Cambells that got spices added to it. But it was nice to have to dip my sandwich into.   As if all that wasn't enough food, my friend ordered the cheesecake for dessert and let me take a few bites. It was very good. The berries and cream taste was wonderful and I was impressed by how light and creamy the cheesecake was. Usually cheesecake is very heavy, but this was just the right balance.  I definitely plan on coming back to the Yard soon!

tJOWJt0-peExidTvtU-UQQ.text: I mean, who can say no to $15 bottomless mimosas on a Sunday morning?  I know I can't!  I can't believe I had not been to this place until a couple of weekends ago when my brother came into town.  He asked where a good place to go for brunch, and I had heard pretty good things about this place.  Given that it's three blocks away from my place, I figured we could have as many mimosas as we wanted, and the wait staff did not disappoint.  Our glasses were seriously never empty.  Never.  Ok, now away from the booze and onto the food.  I think the food was pretty good for the price (particularly in this part of Shadyside).  I had the French toast and my brother had the chicken and waffles, and he loved it.  I definitely need to stop in here again- and maybe for dinner sometime.

mFlHCvUPhS8gP_m4pCpl5g.text: The grilled cheese menu is pretty extensive and interesting. We tried one with sauteed shrimp and jalapenos, and another which was basically a caprese salad with bread. Both were good, although the shrimp one wins in my opinion. Sadly, we both thought the quality of the bread was on the cheap side -- seemed like basic boring white bread. Both sandwiches came with fries (choose from four varieties), but they weren't great -- kind of soggy. Tomato soup was also included, which I thought was a nice touch.   The draft beer menu is extensive and interesting. If I come back, it'll probably be to grab a beer rather than for a meal. Unless the bread gets better...

o5mq-IPAg-vK-bY2R4L_GQ.text: They always have nice and friendly waiters, food that is amazing, and a nice atmosphere. The food isn't cheap but it's not pricey either.  I do wish that they served their sandwiches with fries instead of chips though. Definitely a place you have to try if you are in the Shadyside area!

FEb-B8_gIkaiRwBGCq7Mpg.text: We came here for brunch and were really excited to try it, as it's owned by the same person as Coach's and we're fans of their food.  Their beer menu is excellent and I enjoyed the bloody mary bar. Out of a table of four, we had two grilled cheeses, a burger and a chorizo scramble. Nobody was impressed.   My grilled cheese was on such thick, buttery bread that in was almost inedible. The tomato soup (I use that term loosely) was terrible. The fries were a strange shape, but good. I liked that you could choose a seasoning.  Overall, the menu was interesting and service was good. I could see coming back here for a beer or an appetizer, but the food is just not worth it.

qFDb4SJ_45yXoP98vHJkfg.text: Have you ever been asked out by someone so awesome, so out of your league, that the realization dawns on you in the middle of the date and a nervous panic hits you as you wonder what you could have done to deserve it? Have you ever enjoyed the company of said date so much that your mind descends so deeply into the abyss of self doubt that you question whether you are experiencing reality or some elaborate practical joke at your expense? Then you fast forward 10 years and you're happily married living in an enchanted mushroom in a forest with anthropomorphic woodland creatures helping to raise your beautiful progeny?  That's what eating at The Yard is like.  I have never written a review before or cared enough about any place to do so, but dear god I have seen the light. I was already sold when a friend told me about a place with a menu just full of grilled cheeses, and it only got better. I ordered the Wac Arnold which appeared to be both comically and gustatorily sound. My fragile ego was not equipped to handle such a pure, immaculate sammich. I think I told everyone I know and accosted several strangers on the street to tell them how absurdly good it was. Not to mention the service, it looked like the server had the whole room to take care of by himself and he didn't miss a beat.   Though I may eat foods other than grilled cheese, and I may dine at restaurants that aren't The Yard, it will always be the first time a sandwich truly opened my eyes to how beautiful the world can be. You'll always be in my heart, Wac Arnold.

nRciD0penRgLinSjSixvDA.text: Really disappointed with the brunch.  I realize it's not their specialty; however, when I order an Eggs Benedict anywhere I expect it to be Eggs Benedict, not a hard boiled boiled egg slapped onto a disproportionally large english muffin with two droplets of hollandaise.  The presentation was uninspired and the overall visual quality was comparable to IHOP.  But even then IHOP can compensate for presentation with taste; the flavor of the french toast and pancakes that my dining companions ordered was essentially nonexistent.    Solid atmosphere though.  1/10 would return for brunch, 7/10 would return for dinner.

qd-ZzitCnP8XNtVGN-OqPg.text: I absolutely love this Bar as the newest addition to the Shadyside bar scene. The shop opened this past June and has quickly come to conquer the hearts of locals and various college students alike.  The place used to be a high end Italian stowaway. The dungeon feeling has been retained climbing a set of stairs down in order to get to the location. The space is divided into two portions, to the left - a long stone set bar top lined with drafts and a humongous craft beer chalk board with more than 30 listings rights off the bat. A few tables are scattered around the standing room and a few TVs line the ceiling. Come in for Happy Hour or a night cap, beware of game days it gets packed quickly. To the right, there is the dining room which is predominantly filled with tables, a second bar, TVs around the room and to the back of the restaurant portion there is a happy hour pit which is perfect for group setups.  The drinks - they have a full bar but the seller are their listings of craft beers. Sort these either by alcohol content, type or location. My favorite is the Sweet Baby Jesus [a peanut butter stout]. If you cannot decide, get a flight of 3 and snift your way through.  The food - come to the Yard for a couple reasons: Happy Hour specials, Grilled cheese menu or Brunch. There is a daily special on food, most notably the Juicy Lucy Special [cheese melted into the Burger] with a Beer for $10. Considering a Beer will run you around ~$6-8 dollars which is a steal. The 3 varieties of fries are separate but they are well worth it as well. [I love mine smothered in Parmesan]  There is a whole page dedicated to Grilled Cheese. that's right. The bread is additionally slathered in Butter so it's a decadence of amazing. Get this as a combo with Tomato Soup.  Brunch - Every Sunday come in for the Brunch special. The Yard has a special menu in place simply with brunch paired with a Mimosa or a Bloody Mary. I personally do not like bloody Mary but I have heard great things.  To sum up - Great atmosphere, great Beers, good food. Come again, come often!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Penn chocolate meltdown. And the beer board.

HXHaSuqPzibVFEjwuDlDLg.text: Awful, very greasy grilled cheese & canned tomato soup. This restaurant has a great concept, about 15 different grilled cheeses to pick from however I was so disappointed how terrible the food was. I ordered the fried green tomato grilled cheese with tomato soup & sweet potato fries. The grilled cheese was SO greasy, the fries were soggy & the tomato soup was canned Campbell's Soup or some generic brand (come on, they can't make a tomato soup from scratch). I could barely eat it, I didn't even eat half & couldn't finish. Service was just ok. Didn't have the cleanest feel either.  Very disappointed! Do not waste your time or money eating @ The Yard.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greasy fried green tomato grilled cheese &amp; canned tomato soup. Not good!!

9Y25UDeJD5OO58zb4AbFLA.text: This place has really gone downhill. A few years ago this used to be a solid restaurant, but not anymore. The chips are flavorless, the tomato soup tastes like it's from a can, and the service is ridiculously slow. I have some friends that still love their burgers so I find myself still coming here once in awhile, but there are much better options. If you want a good draft list and good food, I would recommend Urban Tap.

AFT2AMs9h6wXWcW8Y_cgCA.text: Great late night drunk food! Theyre on uber eats so i get their food delivered to my house. Pretty good

ilyCbhAAhRiQxbUA5FiKBA.text: TL;DR Don't go here (for now).  The good: The food.  Actually, it wasn't good, it was great!  I ordered the "Not-Cho Grilled Cheese" when I went there with a friend this past Saturday and my god it was amazing.   The bad: Several things, I'm afraid.    1) The service was pretty slow.  There seemed to be only a single waitress covering the area on a Saturday evening.    2) When we were served our food, we weren't given silverware or napkins.  While #1 can be explained by things outside the restaurant's control (people being out sick, etc.), unfortunately this is... a pretty big miss.  After waiting patiently for a few minutes (perhaps she had gone to fetch some...?) and seeing no sign of these items coming, I finally got up and grabbed 2 sets from an adjacent table just so I could eat my food.  3) The Internet.  This may sound a bit weird, but I am software engineer who works at an ISP, so this sort of thing is both very important to me, and very relevant to my work.  In order to use the wireless network there, you need to type in your Facebook password.  That's a little... creepy.  It's how phishing attacks happen.  Well, "no problem", I thought--I have two-factor auth enabled on my Facebook account, so even if my password is grabbed, my Facebook account is secure.  So I typed in my Facebook password, went into the Facebook app to create a login code, copied it to the clipboard, went to switch back, and... that actually doesn't work under the authentication dialog in the networking control panel on the latest version of Apple IOS.  Oops.  The "authenticate via email option" would also work... if there was cell reception available.  If there wasn't (as was the case with me), I can't check my email, now can I?  Yeah, I know #3 was a bit a long, but that point was a big frustration with me because when I am out of the office, the absolute last thing I want to do is troubleshoot somebody else's Internet setup which does not appear to have been tested in an actual production environment.  All that said, I do want to see this place succeed--the food was great, the server was nice to us, there were a great number of beer selections at the bar, and the atmosphere was nice.  The Yard Gastropub has a lot going for it, and if it can get over some of these rough edges, I'd be willing to give it a second try at some point in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;Not-Cho Grilled Cheese&#34;.  It was delicious!

OYSzEKdQQw7WeDet1PHLxw.text: Scott was our waiter in the back room, we had reservations but didn't need them because it was early, 5:25, so the rush hadn't started yet We had the mac attack app, which was incredible, deep fried ball of mac and cheese which somehow was crispy on the outside and gooey Mac and cheese inside I had the big Che-bowski and it came with soup and fries. I asked for the Cajun style and they were excellent! I posted a pic of the sandwich, also incredible! Cheesy with crispy bacon and a Fried egg on top! Then the beer... I could write another entire review on that!! Great selection, always rotating and they tell you what's coming so you know when to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The big Che-bow ski!!! Yeehaww

Pt-bwv-8vrMPWvKwil9Ihg.text: Just OK for me. The grilled cheeses are fun and with a lot of variety, there's something for everyone. Bottomless mimosas at brunch but I've gotta say - some of my friends were sucking these down very easily and were totally fine when we left...I don't think the champagne to OJ ratio is how it should be for $15. Definitely don't come here looking to save any calories - but if you're in the mood for a grilled cheese, this will do the trick. I do like the tomato soup that comes with the grilled cheeses. Brunch time seems to get pretty crowded here so it's probably worth a reservation if you know you're going ahead of time. Shadyside location has street parking and paid lots close by.

LKdwksxUSDDW2-eJ2O2z5w.text: Usually love this place but this morning changed my mind. My french toast was cold and I ordered the unlimited Bloody Mary bar and was told you're only allowed 5. My waitress was very nice about it, but that's not listed anywhere and it says "unlimited" and nowhere says anything about a limit. Probably won't go back for brunch again

L5tWDorAToNGDhS_VNi9og.text: I've been coming here for a very long time, I would strongly suggest stopping in for a quick bite or a brew.  Erin is a fantastic server and always makes good beer recommendations; the staff is really friendly. There is virtually no wait time for food and the kitchen is open late!   I love the food here, everything from the wild grilled cheese sandwiches to the burgers are full of great flavors. If you happen to make it in time for brunch, please try the Chicken and waffle sliders, they are out of this world.  This is a Shadyside staple and management goes out of their way to accommodate the patrons.

LZGKEvgQnZ2e-v8w3jKLmw.text: A great place in a great location! I have been a regular customer at this location of The Yard, and they always have me coming back from more. Great staff that will make truthful recommendations depending on the dietary restrictions of your party. Always have the sports games going on and you can always expect a great conversation at the bar. Would definitely recommend making a reservation as certain times it can get fairly busy.

w7xFe0rM_qVuhLkZeg0R1A.text: The Yard is one of those places that I really, really want to love...but unfortunately, it falls short for me.  The atmosphere is pretty much that of a typical pub. The restaurant itself is actually underground, which is interesting. I have a hard time with the lack of windows and wish it were a little brighter, but they do have free wifi which is nice! Be warned that it is extremely loud here - I always seem to find myself screaming in order to talk to my friends no matter what time I come.  One of the biggest aspects of The Yard's menu is the grilled cheese. They have dozens of different craft grilled cheeses with all different toppings. I am no stranger to the idea of craft grilled cheese - if you have not heard of MELT in the Cleveland area, you should look it up. It is absolutely phenomenal. Needless to say, MELT has given me extremely high expectations, so I came to The Yard expecting comparably amazing grilled cheese sandwiches. I regret to say that I was disappointed. I have tried The Big Che-bowski as well as the Smack Yo Mama. They're good, but not great. I always feel that the bread is a little hard and the flavors are not as distinct as I would like. I love the concept of getting a cup of tomato soup with your sandwich, but the tomato soup is oddly pasty, and almost everyone I have gone with has disliked it. Overall, the food is a bit of a miss for me.  Most recently, I came to The Yard for the bottomless mimosas deal on a Saturday afternoon. The Yard is one of the only bars in the burgh that seems to do the "bottomless" deal for brunch, and it's really a great bargain. The mimosas are clearly watered down, but at just $15, it's still worth it in my eyes. I have not been overly impressed with the service here - we actually had a waitress who seemed to be ignoring us at our last trip, and had to keep asking other waitresses for assistance when we needed something. Very strange.  Overall, I'm not rushing back to The Yard for dinner anytime soon. The bottomless mimosas are a great deal, and I recommend that on a weekend. Otherwise, there are much better options in Shadyside for dinner.

0hgKuL-2Bs8efM9MV8kctQ.text: Popular place I heard of a while back. Been here two times now and I must say that their staff are very professional. They definitely want you to feel at home and welcome. If possible, I would recommend Mike to be your server.  A grilled cheese restaurant that supposedly mirrors or replicates the Melt in Cleveland, I gotta say that the atmosphere is very bar-esque (but it definitely adds to the Pittsburgh home-y feel). Located in the basement of the complex, you need to descend a flight of stairs all the while looking into the full glass restaurant front. Didn't look too hard but I'd assume not accessible friendly.   Tried Poppin My Collar (a shrimp type) and Simple Jack (no meats). The breads are more thickly cut (not my preference) but it definitely saves you from the meal being overly cheesy. My only issue would be that the bread is super oily but that's part of the grilled cheese experience I think. The sandwich itself isn't too big and its paired with a thicker tomato soup and a tin of fries (you get your pick on type from old bay to garlic Parmesan).  Went on a Wednesday which is their special for whiskeys and wines. They ask for how you'd like your drink made which is nice, but one issue I just remembered was that my drink made on the rocks was served without cocktail straws. Iced drinks are a choking hazards when had from the rim.   Overall though a great place I feel I can always come to for that comfort food! Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Poppin My Collar. The whole presentation on a wooden cheese board
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Simple Jack and soup. Couldn&#39;t resist the bites before I remembered to take some photos haha

U6UMU08kBztqVu0Tzt_AnA.text: I had read the previous reviews mentioning the disappointing oj ratio in the bottomless mimosas, but decided to see for myself. Sure enough, they were overly sweet and 3/4 orange juice. I probably had a total of 6 or 7 and didn't feel the slightest buzz. Service was also poor and slow. The Yard does have tasty food and is a fun place to come for a few beers, but next time I want a boozy brunch in Shadyside I'll stick to Shady Grove and their delicious $3 mimosas.

q8veEJUbNrz1OJfnTj9FeA.text: Being a big fan of cheese (grilled or otherwise), I had been itching to try out this place devoted to this mighty sandwich. We went on a Saturday night around 9, and it was packed. I think we waited around 30 mins, which wasn't too bad.  We were seated in the main dining room and it was LOUD. I mean, it was a Saturday night and everything, so maybe I shouldn't be too harsh, but I don't love having to lean across the table to converse with my husband. They have a HUGE draft list, and we started off with a couple of beers. We were also pretty hungry, so we ordered the pub pretzels as an appetizer. These were standard issue pretzel sticks served with mustard and beer cheese dips. The pretzels were warm and soft with just the right amount of sauce, and the dips were tasty (especially the beer cheese), so no complaints there. For the grilled cheese, I got the Daniel Lafferty, which essentially has all of the components of a chicken parm (chicken, cheese, basil and marinara), while my husband got the Wang Chung Tonight (gouda, Asian slaw and pulled chicken). Each sandwich comes with a side of tomato soup and choice of fries (I got the garlic parm fries and my husband opted for sweet potato fries).  My grilled cheese was just okay. I mean, there was nothing particularly wrong with it, but there was nothing spectacular either. The sandwich was pretty small. They did use fresh mozzarella cheese, which was a nice touch. But for $12, I felt like it was overpriced and I could have made something just as good or better at home. The tomato soup that came with the grilled cheese was a bust. It was lukewarm, too thick, and had an off-putting smokey taste (but not a natural smoke flavor, the weird added fake kind). It was not appealing at all. Even the fries were lackluster...the garlic parm seasoning was delicious, but it seems as though I got the scraps of the fry batch, as many were short stubs. My husband did enjoy his grilled cheese. Unfortunately, his sweet potato fries came loaded with sugar and cinnamon...I wish they would note that on their menu, because neither of us is a fan of sweet potato fries served that way. So sadly, his fries went untouched.  On the dessert side of things, my husband noticed a s'mores donut dessert that he wanted to try (he is obsessed with donuts as a dessert food even though I insist they are to be strictly consumed for breakfast). So I begrudgingly agreed to get that for dessert. Well, it was literally just a glazed donut on a plate surrounded by some whipped cream and topped with marshmallow sauce, fudge, and graham crackers. That's it....a $ 0.50 donut fancied up with a few toppings and they charged $7 for it. Now those are some high food margins! Needless to say, the dessert was quite underwhelming (even my husband the donut fiend thought so), especially for such a high price.  Overall, I walked out of The Yard feeling like I had spent too much money for what I had received. Next time I might just walk over to the grocery store and get some bread and cheese and make my own dang sandwich.

YXtDQwGlFyopgYk68kO_-w.text: My husband and I went on a Wednesday, around 6pm, definitely not a busy time. We were quickly seated in the dining room where there were 4 other tables of 2. We waited for ten minutes with no one coming to greet us, or take our drink order. Two waitresses were in the room, they both saw us but walked past our table several times without acknowledging us. After waiting five more minutes with no one coming to our table, we got up and left. We will NOT return and will share this experience with our friends.

ut6ofezEEIXCnpB7WbVbyw.text: We love this place so much we took some engagement photos here! Seriously. My fiance and I met at this bar three years ago and we've since moved out of Shadyside but we continue to come back!  The bar itself is my favorite part. The atmosphere is Gastropub/a little hipster downstairs. The bartenders are always friendly and quick to take care of you. My favorite part: the beer selection. If you enjoy craft beer this is the place for you! Also, nice sized TVs to watch sports while you drink a few or eat some brunch!   The food: LOVE the grilled cheeses. I usually get the Fried Green Tomato and I'm never disappointed. Brunch is also amazing. My favorite is the chicken and waffles for sure, but the Breakfast Club is also delicious and super hearty.  You won't regret bringing a group to The Yard or just planning it as your next date night to grab a few!

8kt5VytoaIA06U07JsaTJQ.text: I stopped by here not too long ago on a Thursday evening with my wife and another couple for dinner.  We had made reservations through opentable but as soon as we entered the dining room portion of the restaurant I could tell that was unnecessary.  The Yard is located on Bellefonte Street down a flight of stairs.  Upon entering the restaurant you are in the bar area with the dining room to the left.  After checking in the hostess led us to our table in the dining room.  The most distinctive feature that I remember of it was that it had a number of flat screen TV's which means that you had a view of at least one no matter where you were at.  The Yard has a pretty nice sized beer menu with a large number of craft beers.  So to start out the evening I went with the Sierra Nevada Narwhal which I hadn't seen before, or since for that matter.  Then for my entree I went with the Smack Yo Mama Grilled Cheese.  I mean how can you not go for a grilled cheese whenever you visit a place that has a grilled cheese section of the menu.  It consisted of BBQ pulled chicken, onion straws and beer cheese.  As you can imagine there's not much that you can dislike about that comfort food and it was pretty much as good as it sounds.  Then for my side I substituted in the Mac and cheese for the tomato soup.  It was also pretty good as the cheese sauce was tasty and the spiral pasta held it nicely.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  The yard with its grilled cheese menu is almost the ultimate comfort food spot, now if that could only be good for my waist.

D_RUJKOuOYpHKQ_i63zCrA.text: They have lots of good beer. Sadly, food came out cold, and service was glacial. Burgers were extremely unimpressive. Quite the waste of money.

Lvea2ZjelP_EpMhLgdidLA.text: We came for brunch on a Saturday afternoon and the food was great! There was a lot of flavor in the breakfast club which was what I got. It was a good combination but there was a lot going on and it was hard to enjoy everything. I would definitely return for brunch however but it is not the best brunch that I've ever had. Our two waiters were great and had awesome personalities. The atmosphere of the restaurant was nice but it was kind of confusing to figure out where the hostess station was at first. Overall a great experience and I would come back next time I'm in town!

ILpseYKu2C_PZcLrMtxUCw.text: I really wanted to like this place, I'd heard good things and was super excited to come here. Everything just seemed tasteless. I got the Monte Christo and it was very bland and mushy. the chips looked like it was the bottom of the pan and I got the little bits of crumbs left over. my wife's Caesar salad was terrible and tasteless. the sweet potato fries were good. I just really was very disappointed with the meal all together. I feel like it was a waste of money and I don't believe we will return or recommend this place. we also were placed under a TV and I smacked my head as we were leaving so that kind of capped off the night.   edit: the waitress was very good and attentive.

bjlwDjtwoAvH6HYQaclBkA.text: I had the crab meat grilled cheese, it was absolutely delicious. 13 dollars for a grilled cheese is pricey but it is a good experience every once in a while!

uG37oYBwrqouGk7gQfMNqw.text: Wandered into The Yard last Sunday after a long bike ride.  My husband and I were starving! We were greeted by a really nice hostess who told us to pick a table.  We opted for the dining room over the bar and found a table against the wall.  A waitress came over very promptly and noticed we were perusing the tap list.  She told us to take a look and in the meantime would bring us waters.  I found this to be really nice instead of hovering over my shoulder while I selected my beer.  So far so good.  After we ordered our drinks they were brought to us very quickly and we ordered.  First, the menu is great.  The names of the grilled cheese sandwiches are from movies/tv/just funny which we appreciated.  I had the cheesy capresey and my husband had the big che-bowski.  Both sandwiches were fantastic and came with fries and really good tomato soup.  I truly appreciate their attention to quality, local food.  We will be back!

X-ADju6dN8zlOVesteMzwA.text: I heard of The Yard from a coworker who was impressed with their entire page of Grilled Cheese options on the menu. I was drawn in by the $15 unlimited mimosas. I stopped in for brunch on Sunday and was surprised to see the place had many available tables at 10:30AM. Shadyside was bustling about, parking was limited in the streets and in the Bellefonte/Ivy lots, but the Yard was surprisingly empty.  Let's start with the good -  The menu has lots of options. The brunch options are only one page long, but the rest of the menu was full of page after page of great options. My friend got Chicken and Waffles and said "This was a great decision" as she spread cinnamon butter onto her thick waffles. I ordered a chorizo scramble, which came out with a drizzle of sour cream on top. We both downed delicious Mimosas. Our waitress was attentive and always had the next mimosa on deck, ready for us before we had to ask. I am not sure if the entire menu is available during brunch hours - in hindsight, I wish the waitress would have made mention of that. But she was fabulous. She was friendly and attentive.   Now let's look at the not-so-good- Since the location is in the basement of a building, there is little-to-no cell reception. Not a deal breaker, but mildly annoying. Also, the small space is very echoy. There were two rather loud groups - One was a large group of girls, half of whom were still wearing clothes from the night before, the others looking like they had just rolled out of bed. ALL of them were loud and annoying. The other loud group was directly behind us, and we could hear every word to every conversation they had...which was especially annoying because they were rude to the waitress and complaining about everything. I think that most of this could be corrected by addressing the acoustics in the dining area. Maybe something to absorb the sound? It was just a little too harsh and echoy for a relaxing brunch. Now, much of this was because of the obnoxious people, but it could have been made less severe by the design of the room.   The cell reception and the acoustics are the only things standing in the way of 5 stars. I am looking forward to returning and trying one of those grilled cheese sandwiches! They have great, creative names, and they all sound delicious!

Bl50UJeLetMu8Lt5s64T6w.text: We went here for the first time yesterday. My husband and I both ordered two different grilled cheese sandwiches and they were delicious! They have many french fry options, different kinds like sweet potato, and seasonings like old bay and garlic parm. We were surprised at how much food we got for $10-12 a meal. I was disappointed however in the make your own bloody mary bar. I love bloody marys and was excited to hear about this bar from the waitress. The bar ran out of some items and it was slow to be restocked. I also felt that the glass with vodka that's given to you by the waitress was pretty watered down. When we got our check and I saw that it cost $18 for the bloody mary bar I couldn't believe it. I definitely didn't feel like I got my money's worth.

y58IU9oIVsYMBmShLsu9rA.text: This is hands down the best brunch I've ever had. The chicken and waffles were amazing, the bottomless mimosas were refilled quickly and our waiter was hilarious. Can't speak for people who had less positive experiences here but I'll be back the next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

US5gA4ur1yttB_0eokdfPQ.text: This place was ok, hubby enjoyed it way more than me--but it was not crowded on Tuesday night when we had time to kill so we went in. Hubby ordered a Dogfish Beer, and thought it was excellent. I had an angry Palmer, and just tasted sugar, could not taste/feel any alcohol. For $9, I expect more!! We decided to share the poutine, which we devoured, but I thought the stout gravy was a bit too strong--hubby loved this dish. He also got the Juicy Lucy burger--loved this too, it did look amazing.  I has the lettuce wraps, meh--I've had better. Too much sauce on top, not enough crunch factor.  I would not order it again.  The place also smelled like a sewer, which I can understand because it is in a basement!!   :-/

4uqdCzKsIZ06OPf18I6g7g.text: It seems that many folks complain about the service. I have been there recently and the place was good. The sandwich were very ... well .... greasy but this is what you expect when you go in this type of place, right? The beer selection is good with a lot of local selection. On my part, the service was good and on time. Will definitively come back, way better than many other places in that area.

2-n16LcOLK9TesW8uJdNig.text: Went to The Yard on a Friday night with a group of six without reservations. There was not a hostess at the hostess stand so we walked to the dining room and stood at the bar until a hostess cleaned off a table. Not a big deal, if we wanted a smoother seating we should have called ahead. We had a great waiter who was knowledgable and accommodating, but our first round of drinks took about 15 minutes to get to the table.   Now to the food. I was super excited about the menu. Everything looked great, especially the extensive grilled cheese menu. I decided on the Asian Lettuce Wraps with Thai Chili Chicken and my boyfriend ordered the Juicy Lucy Burger. We both found ourselves very disappointed with our meals. First, I ordered chicken for my lettuce wraps and had a terribly difficult time finding and actual piece of chicken. Don't get me wrong, the flavor was good but the entire wrap was a bunch of watercress with possibly some shredded chicken here and there. Unfortunately for me, I'm not a big fan of watercress. Next, my boyfriends Juicy Lucy burger, which is supposed to contain cheddar cheese cooked between beef, seriously lacked any cheese at all. I've never been anywhere where someone ordered a Juicy Lucy and I was anticipating a bunch of gooey cheese spilling out of the burger like you see on the travel shows, but there was none of that here. Otherwise, he said the burger itself was good, just missed the mark. Our friend enjoyed their food, including the Jerk Grilled Cheese and a flatbread pizza.   Perhaps since The Yard specializes in grilled cheese, that's what we'll have to go for next time.  This time though, The Yard was a couple yards short of a touchdown.

9htkqaWYmX2XlxNbBUTZZw.text: Can't say enough positive things about this place!  Food: great, service: great, staff: great!  This place is new, so I had a few reserves, but they were soon set at ease... This place seems like it's been up and running for years, everything went so smoothly.    I ordered the pulled-pork nachos, and soon noticed I set a trend at the bar, as I watched the bartenders serve 4-5 additional orders to fellow patrons around us!... Yes, they look and taste THAT good!  Right now, they have all the fall favorites on tap!!! AMAZING!  If you're looking for a great selection of beer and some decently priced food... This place is a must!

bSWEYYSEvKaPmXAiPZlkKw.text: food is amazingly average; manager was extremely rude. never wrote a yelp review before, but felt extremely inclined after this horrible experience. also they forgot to bring us all our orders.

nRL8uEMK7dzXgXR4cU2XHg.text: This was my first time here. I got a burger and substituted a small bowl of mac and cheese for the fries for $4 extra. Prices are a bit expensive for what you get. The burger was only okay. I ordered mine medium and it came out rare to medium rare. I'm not extremely picky about my burgers, but if a restaurant makes burgers to order and asks you how you want it done, it should be done right. It was okay in all, but I probably won't be coming back. It was $35 pre-tip for me and my girlfriend. She got a flatbread and fries, and I got a burger and mac and cheese. Seems way overpriced, in my opinion, and the food could use some work.

iQSscS1X9jO4oRHjYoWEwg.text: Love the service, beer, food and atmosphere!  Especially the Sunday brunch!!   One of Pittsburgh's hidden treasures!

nzT0oBsFnqH09NVFkPfPHw.text: Fantastic pub, great crowd. Food was great, we loved the hot pretzels and burgers. Beer selection was really diverse as well. Bartenders and wait staff were very knowledgeable about the different beers and their service was excellent. Been to this bar a few times since its opened....definitely the best pub in Shadyside!!

v8xgiEZSFQ9Ss0SzoRlxMQ.text: I had the Belgian waffle stuffed with egg, bacon and cheese. I would not recommend this. The waffle and the accompanying tater tots tasted like they had come from the frozen section at Giant Eagle.

ZAlojvHMTn_jek5ipsnGrQ.text: Bad experience.  Terrible food.  I came with four friends. Three of us had grilled cheese varieties (their specialty), one got a burger, and one got a steak sandwich. We had poutine fries and wings for appetizers. Everything we ate was bad. The burger says well done in the menu. It was raw. Not rare. Raw. The wings were soggy and tasted like liver. The poutine fries had no cheese curds, meaning they were not poutine fries. They were just fries with gravy. And not good gravy. The grilled cheese came with tomato soup which tasted like BBQ sauce and served luke warm. The grilled cheese sandwiches were served on bland Texas toast and were mediocre at best. Additionally, plates would be nice. They serve the sandwiches on cutting boards and we all ended up with crumbs all over us. The sweet potato fries were soggy and luke warm - although to be fair, this is True most places. Sweet potato fries are usually this way. The steak sandwich was disgusting. No seasoning. 10% steak, 90% bread. Two star rating only because the staff was cool and they have good beer on tap. Avoid eating here.

xr8YYs70iugbiWsCxhxNyQ.text: I went to the Yard this weekend and the drink and food was actually pretty good, but I will never go back. I used my American Express card to pay for the meal, totaling about 34 dollars and change. As a former waiter, I always appreciate tips in cash. I left $7 in cash for the tip, and wrote in 0 tip on the credit card receipt. Now, a few days later I found that the Yard charged my credit card for 41$. The waiter got away with my cash tip PLUS added another 7$ onto the credit card for himself. I've opened up a dispute with American Express, and I am writing this to warn people about the scam running at the Yard. DO NOT GO HERE!

lVHs1J-5gA1uLcvKZlKYoA.text: Best pub food around Walnut St with a good atmosphere, endless beer selection and plenty of TVs for big sporting events.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

l2Ao7t_qWt4fPb4SvZwzgQ.text: Stopped in here on a moderately busy Monday evening. My friend and I stood around for about two or three minutes, awkwardly close to the table closest to the front door, waiting to be seated. Finally, a guy in shorts and an Under Armour shirt seated us in the dining area.   Priding itself on its beer selection, The Yard has a sizable list to choose from. However, the format looks like an Excel spreadsheet transposed onto a menu. If The Yard is going to stake its name as beer-loving gastropub, and it certainly seems that way, I want to know more about the beers they offer. The Monday night special was 16oz. local crafts for $4. I went with Full Pint's "Night of the Living Stout." I'm a malty, dark beer guy and was immediately turned off by the rather intense hops flavor not present in most porters and stouts. Had I known this is how the beer tasted ahead of time, I wouldn't have ordered it. I'll take some blame for not sampling it, though. It could be the beer itself, or the way it was poured/drafted, but there was no head on it by time it came to the table and it tasted somewhat flat. I returned the beer, something I hardly ever do.  I had the roasted turkey sandwich, described on their menu as thus: fresh thyme baked turkey breast/thick carved/lettuce/tomato/onion/lemon aioli/artisan roll. Pros included the bread and the amount of meat. However, the turkey breast, admittedly a tough protein to keep from drying out, was just that, causing a dryness in each bite. The lemon aioli hardly showed up, and when it dripped onto my wax paper-covered cutting board below, it was watery. The red onion was the strongest flavor to come through, which, I don't think was the intention of whomever created this dish. The fries, many of which resembled the shape of an apostrophe, were slightly crispy on the outside, soft in the center and slightly on the greasy side for my taste. My dish, ultimately, was forgettable, rather than memorably bad. My friend, who ordered the seafood mac'n'cheese, said it was "alright" and that she wished the crab throughout wasn't so finely divvied up throughout the dish.   The service was subpar in my opinion. The servers seemed to be hard at work and always on the go, but perhaps too much so. Maybe they were understaffed. Awkwardly standing around to be greeted and seated didn't make a great first impression on me and the meals were served without silverware. When our server stopped to ask us if everything was satisfactory around mid-meal, I got a "yeah..." out before he was onto the next table. When check time came, he failed to ask if my friend and I were splitting the bill, which we were. Fortunately, I had cash to pay her.  I'm normally not so critical of restaurants. I'm not a food snob and having worked for a time in the industry, know that working in a restaurant isn't the easiest job out there. I'd much rather write positive reviews and don't go out of my way to write negative ones. The dining room, hardly separated from the pub area, was a bit loud for carrying on a conversation and catching up with my friend. Bottom line: the food and service needs to improve. I would come here again to drink, but until it's evident the food gets better, I wouldn't eat here. I think this place has potential, but with a lot of options in Shadyside, The Yard needs to improve quickly.

Z4Nd2I-TaYDbZK80pzKVdQ.text: My friends and I were EXTREMELY disappointed with The Yard.  First of all, we were seated at a table in some dark corner where we couldn't really see. It was so dark, in fact, that we were forced to use our cell phone flashlights in order to be able to read the menu (to put it into perspective, I have 20/20 vision, but still couldn't read it). Anyway, for me, I ordered the lettuce wrap with shrimp, but was served the lettuce wrap with chicken instead.  I considered telling the waitress, but figured that it wasn't a big deal and that I'd eat it anyway since I didn't want it to go to waste.  BIG mistake.  I normally wouldn't have thought that shredded chicken could go all that wrong, but for whatever reason the chicken was REALLY chewy and tough, so much so that it was hard to even eat.  Normally, I'm not one to not finish my meal, but after a certain point even I couldn't eat it.  My friend, who ordered a different dish with pulled chicken, thought the same exact thing.  In addition, another friend ordered the spinach dip (also something that I didn't think could be easily messed up), but we were all extremely disappointed by that too (we all thought it was really bland and too cream cheesy...where was spinach?).  Everyone was also disappointed with the tomato gazpacho, which the group unanimously agreed tasted like cold tomato sauce.  Originally, when we were looking at the menu, we thought that the dessert looked really good, but after a disappointing meal we didn't even bother with that.  Plus, at one point they ended up bringing over a Caesar salad to our table which no one had ordered, and only after we went out of our way to ask about it did they realize that they had delivered it to the wrong table.  Overall, mediocre service, bad table, bad food...not impressed, and I'm rather shocked that it has as many stars as it does.

pdk6FS7FFh3c3HgjvE4cTA.text: Ordered the stew  not one piece of meat  after a day when my school went on lockdown  thanks!  And the snow  bring it on!  Won't order there again

b2khg9ljRcggFIxJJa0caA.text: I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised with The Yard Gastropub their Burgers and beer selections were great.  The server hooked up me up with extra french fries after he saw how much I enjoyed them.  I was up in Pittsburgh for work and I decided to stop by and was definitely not let down.  I highly recommend the Pub pretzels with beer cheese dip for an app

aVb-AZ23HlmPc8Dy8OaPvA.text: Best chicken salad I've ever had! The chicken was cooked absolutely perfect! Kitchen effin ROCKS. Love you guys.

XN8Iu-t-cEuL334C8trpGw.text: Went for lunch during the week and ordered It's always sunny in Philadelphia aka a steak sandwich on Texas toast. I was a little disappointed because it wasn't screaming grilled cheese. We also ordered the fried green tomato grilled cheese which was fantastic. Fries were good. Mac and cheese was okay. To end on a good note, they have a huge beer list with reasonable prices.

62v_BhWMo7-RTFMGDUZZ7g.text: This place is amazing!  I could eat here daily and never complain.  The ONLY thing stopping me from giving 5 stars is Wayne.  The manager.  He's not anyone that I would ever put in charge of customer service/relations.  My friend had a question about her bill.  She didn't want a charge dropped, she just wanted it explained.  In the most condescending way, Wayne explained the charge and how every restaurant charges that way and how she basically needs to to know why he's right.    Go for the food.  Stay for the atmosphere.  Leave because of Wayne.

L_L2tmW8u4g3MK9rXU3dMA.text: Great atmosphere and cool joint to hang out to have a beer. They also have an interesting and unique selection of specialty grilled cheese sandwiches. We ordered the crab sandwich and the PBJ sandwich which was very good. Will definitely come back again!

FK3AABVGVdKkKtH6yXuvkA.text: Went there for a Sunday brunch.  We got seated immediately, and the waitress came over within five minutes.  It was 11:55 and half of the dining room was empty.  Prior to ordering food, I ordered the Bloody Mary bar which was $18 for unlimited Bloody Marys  between 10-1 (on-line menu indicated $24)  Twenty minutes later I still did not get my drink even though the waitress apologized three times for it not yet being ready.  I mean, how long does it take to fill a glass with ice and vodka!  It finally came and I went to the Bloody Mary bar to finish off my drink.  The self-make bar was underwhelming. It contained four containers of tomato juice ranging from mild, medium, diablo and beware; only two hot sauces, celery sticks, lemon wedges and olives.  They also had bacon strips as garnish which was surprising different, however, they did not have any toothpicks or other utensils to pick these items out od their serving dishes.  I consumed my drink within 5 minutes and patiently waited for a refill on the vodka.  The waitress passed our table at least four times over the next twenty minutes looking at the empty glass but not offering a refill.  Finally, I just asked her to change the order from the unlimited bar to the one time drink.  We ordered our food off of the brunch menu and also ordered a flatbread appetizer.  FYI, flatbreads are only $5 Sunday afternoons.  The food came rather quickly.  The breakfast scramble was huge and was tasty.  The order of Johnny cakes was also tasty but did not come with the noted maple syrup drizzle or the sweet buttercream.  Had to ask for syrup as well as  silverware. The bill noted that it was an ala carte order which was not what I requested.  The flatbread was also good but came at the same time as the rest of our meals.  Bottom line, food was good, service not so much. Will go back again to see if it was  just a fluke.  The menu is varied and eclectic and I would like to try a majority of the items on it, but if service does not improve, not going to do so.

DO-LPNu2UVqQiOS6cmGb5A.text: the food was just ok.  I wouldn't have even ordered anything other than a beer had we not seen the sign downstairs that said 'grilled cheese night: 1/2 off grilled cheese 7-10'.    both my boyfriend and I were disappointed in the food.  the cheese was even melty when it got to us and the bread was greasy.  Sandwiches weren't even hot, which is the whole point of grilled cheese.  Seasoned chips were ok but they weren't really seasoned evenly.  It seemed like they dumped all the old bay seasoning on the top of the chips.  Turns out when we got the bill that everything was full price and the waitress said that the 'grilled cheese night' is Monday only.  Wish they would have taken the sign down by Wednesday night when we were there.    We won't be eating there again.

PoQQEoz1cFcjFHXjLcz6uA.text: If you like food that tastes like grease , you'll likeThe Yard! My sandwich was fried green tomatoes, bacon & cheese.  The bacon was not cooked & the tomatoes were laden with grease.  The tomato soup was ugh!  My friend had a steak sandwich & cheese.  She said it was awful and left it and the soup.  It's the worst restaurant in Shadyside.  Fast food is better than this food!

WyCvEhxIBE6i6JnJeJdEng.text: Been in Pittsburgh for a week... This is the 2nd best Bonaventure "for beer"  I've been.  Red headed bartender is a douche bag though... Serious attitude from, the beginning, with that guy.  I'm not even  a stupid underage College duche bag. Asked the guy to call me a cab and he could've cared less about ME OR others and their safety.   What a dick!   Again, beer choices WERE AWESOME! bartender w/blond /red hair..  Douche bag!

PZQTCvasFuJU9ZVjBdQuQw.text: Really different grilled cheese sandwiches. I had the pierogies a'nt and the husband had turkey Cristo. Lots of meat. Enjoyed everything but the tomato soup.  It kinda tasted like spaghetti sauce

u54J_5DYJHfqXEKelv6ExA.text: Okay the food when we finally got it was good and hot. That's about the only thing they got right though. The service was terrible. Food took 45 minutes, bartender seemed way too busy, and it seemed like we annoyed him just by sitting down, he didn't know the menu when we asked questions, his nonchalant attitude was not endearing at all, I ordered toast I never got, and I didn't get the side of home fries that the menu said my short rib delight came with. Ugh. When I finished my meal I realized it should have come with homefries. When I told him I didn't get them his response was, "why didn't you bring it to my attention earlier". Rude. If you don't like people, get out of the service industry. There is nothing worse than a server or bartender who only sees me as a tip.

evBr1N6-WOyFYhJa9iZBJg.text: Without a doubt, this place is pretty awesome. Half off grilled cheese menu on Mondays. Will definitely be back to try something else. Was chill with good wait staff and fast service.

dEwKdXcHc8rtnWrXV2Aozw.text: The Afternoon Delight grilled cheese was great. I was not a fan of the parmesan and garlic fries because it was mostly the fry batter with too little potato. Our waitress was amazing, and I would definitely recommend it.

m8pg97vQTKcE-4LI-nd0FA.text: The grilled cheese come on the thickest bread known to man. So it looks like you aren't paying way too much for a $12 grilled cheese but you mostly just taste toast. There is a good beer selection and the pretzels are really good!!

mi52r4ozHL5nb8hwr9tYgA.text: This by far is my favorite place in the burgh right now. Let's just start with what they're known for: grilled cheese. And not just some ho-hum list of basic ideas. They really think out of the box! Plus their endless lists of beers on tap to wash it all down. Each of their grilled cheeses is paired with a choice of seasoned fries and a small cup of tomato soup. This part was my favorite. Their soup has a hint of smoky flavor to it that sets it far apart from the Campbell's that most grew up having with their sandwich. I love to go during brunch for bottomless mimosas. It's the perfect shady side spot.

0vs4KSlfdS7ua52Azb_Erg.text: I went to brunch at the yard with 5 friends on 9/13/14. It was fairly busy, but the restaurant was extremely ill equipped for the brunch crowd. We did not receive our food for an hour and 15 minutes after we were seated, and were at the restaurant for a total of two hours. In these two hours, the waitress never apologized, refilled coffee or even acknowledged the fact that we had been sitting there without food for a ridiculous amount of time. One of our friends had to leave to make it to a wedding and had to shovel in his food within 5 minutes.   The food was decent, but it's hard to really enjoy the food when you're irritated.

r4dI_eJeK7ljheku9RrFBw.text: If you like trendy brunch food and bottomless mimosas, this place is for you! They also have a large list of grilled cheese sandwiches, draft beers, and homemade donuts.

SMCgxQvelb7VsO8cM8AdxQ.text: Not a good experience.  Please note this place is in a basement, no air conditioning on the 90+ degree day in Pittsburgh.  The wait staff must have been affected by it because our waitress was so less than pleasant. When asked which of the 20 grilled chesse she preferred.  Her answer, "do it like grilled cheese!"  WHAT?  Have a positive opinion please.  I ordered the "special" some sort of sausage quiches.  Be aware - this was not like any quiches I have experienced in the past.  Very, very dry.  Not sure if they even used egg.  I asked for our check when the waitress finally returned to our table (no offer on refill of drinks) in a restaurant w/o AC.  Her comment this time "can't believe you want your check already."  I was attempting to be patient, things break (A/C) but the waitress sealed this deal.  We won't be back.

hf1j-R6tTtsrdAJEpEmVUQ.text: The best way to describe this place is different. The main thing featured on their menu is a significant selection of grilled cheese sandwiches. That doesn't sound like anything special, but these aren't your normal grilled cheese sandwiches. Instead they are filled with things such as crab cakes.   That's not all they have though, as the menu is filled with a lot of different things that I want to head back to try. And the menu is done very well with an excellent sense of humor- I had really wanted to try the "because I got high" dessert, but I filled up on my entree and will have to get that next time.  The other thing that's different about this place is its downstairs in its building and walking down there into the front door hostess stand/bar gives you the feeling as though you are headed to some underground basement. It's a little loud in there, but it's got a nice atmosphere overall.

IPeqlhBO_Pcb_iaQXX9TkQ.text: A+. The atmosphere, service, and most of all, the food is top notch. I have visited this restaurant three times now. Whatever you do, it is an absolute must that you order the fries, sweet potato or normal, either way, it is a win. They are very accommodating to large groups but would be a great choice for a date as well.

Alt3fCJTfaVhikHta5IJIw.text: The Yard is one of my favorite places if I am looking for a unique dining experience.  Gourmet grilled cheese is their speciality, as yes, it is as good as it sounds! I have tried several and none of them disappoint. They also have a delectable brunch that offers bottomless mimosas (hello, sign me up!) and a bloody mary bar to pair with delectable gourmet breakfast and lunch options.  They've recently updated their happy hour which has provided a wider range of options! Multiple locations, I have always gone to the one in Shadyside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac n cheese grilled Cheese
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bottomless Mimosas!

74lzGPR3iiFMl6ad6aqAfw.text: MY first attempt at The Yard was for brunch a few weeks ago. We quickly glanced over their menu and sadly didn't find anything interesting so we decided to leave.  We tried again a few weeks later. It was happy hour so we took advantage of it by getting all apps.... fried pretzels, mac & cheese balls, wings & fries.  Loved the fries (& their ranch!) everything was great. I found the mac balls a little too salty but ive cut back a lot on sodium so im senstive to its taste now.

OfJgiYMqUvhbM8iD8yI3Ug.text: We came here for dinner one night and I got the tomato soup and the fried green tomatoes grilled cheese. My grilled cheese and my boyfriend's grilled cheese both tasted like the bread was really sticks of butter, but we were hungry and toughed it out. We felt a little off after eating there, but I generally have the stomach of a titan and assumed it would pass. It did not. Please read amazon reviews about harino sugar free gummy bears to understand how the rest of our night went.

ffC2oPEG0wCQA3cOlLg_QQ.text: Sandwiches are actually a little too complicated for my simple tastes, but still good. Chips are okay. Mac & cheese is good. Prices are pretty fair. Good service and cool interior. Open late, which is nice since it's kinda hard to find food late at night in Shadyside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious

qOUo2aVauYF7GZFxvflJcA.text: You can't beat this place! We went on a Friday night with a packed house and they made us feel like we were the only ones in the restaurant. From the host who went off of his way to help our large party to the wait staff who was friendly and attentive, to the managers both of whom stopped by at different times to see if we needed anything. The food and beer was great too there sandwiches were delicious and they have an awesome beer selection too. The prices were on the money too. You can't beat this place!!

nGHt4CVkHmnEay4GRn_3JA.text: I grabbed brunch here on Saturday because there was a huge line at Cafe Moulin. For peak brunch time, it was pretty easy to grab a table and were served very quickly.  I ordered the French toast and it was okay, very thick and super sugary. It was definitely brunch appropriate. Behind us was a Bloody Mary bar but I only saw it used once. Guess it wasn't a popular draw.  I wasn't overly thrilled with my brunch experience there and I felt indifferent. I'd like to go back for dinner and see how I feel about those items.   While there were families eating there with a wide age range of children, the atmosphere was "bro-y" to me.  That might not be a negative, just stating what I observed. Also seemed like a dark place you'd want to head to after waking up with a hangover.   Overall: Kind of loud, super dark - not the best brunch atmosphere, but worth a shot to try for dinner and drinks.

vywV9yp3f25aP6CscTfH3A.text: I have been interested in trying the Yard for a few months now, and I came here with a friend after a 9 PM class ended one night.  There was a Steeler's game so the place was packed, but we still were seated right away.  I ended up with the Mac Attack ($12).  This was a grilled cheese on Texas toast with mac and cheese in-between.  The Texas toast and the cheese weren't anything special.  On the other hand, the mac and cheese was spectacular.  It was loaded on the grilled cheese, and I would recommend getting a side of mac and cheese if you come here.  This is some of my favorite mac and cheese in Pittsburgh!  Each grilled cheese comes with tomato soup and fries.  The tomato soup went untouched between my friend and I.  It tasted like marinara sauce.  It was good to dip your grilled cheese in, but it was too much alone.  As I don't really eat fries, I was surprised to enjoy the ones here.  They have plenty of specialty options, with NO up-charge, and I liked the garlic parmesan fries.  My only complaint was that our waitress was slightly over-attentive.  She was over three times in five minutes pressuring us to order.  At 9:30 PM, there were still some tables left so it was just a touch off-putting.  Otherwise, I really enjoyed my evening here.  They have lots of daily specials!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac Attack Grilled Cheese ... $12

QIAYiR5HNT-akZyqj_9wWw.text: We were glad to find something open late in the neighborhood. Nice space. Good beer list. I was excited for the grilled cheese sandwich and having lived in the south the fried green tomato was the logical choice. Homemade chips were tasty as was the tomato soup. I have mixed feelings about the sandwich. The Texas toast was greasy and overpowering. Too much bread and tasted like they used Crisco and not butter. A lot of bacon and too little fried green tomato. Overall ok but not what I had hoped.

0hHYfu1_gG0ETAHf10AqlA.text: We went to The Yard for the first time and thought the food was really fun. It was cold outside, so the parking garage next door was very convenient. We originally came for the house dessert, but were pleasantly surprised by our grilled cheese sandwiches too. The mac n cheese would have been better with a bit more flavor, it was kind of bland. The dessert was absolutely the best part of the meal, it's a sandwich stuffed with Nutella, peanut butter and banana and then deep fried in a batter that tastes like funnel cake. Then it's smothered with marshmallow fluff and drizzled with chocolate sauce. I was blown away by the size and the flavor. It seems like a trendy place and I can imagine it would get quite busy during prime time. The service was really great too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

03AY538XC-GhwGCQ7nxQug.text: This is my FAVORITE brunch place in Pittsburgh. I mean they have a great offering of amazing options and the prices are nice. I always get the brunch o bro and instead of bacon I get short rib which is dynamite. I recommend trying it out. The bottomless mimosas is also a great sell and the Bloody Mary bar is always loaded with great options.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch bro

pWSgzF2BW2CGC6FASlJ5GQ.text: When you order a "gourmet" grilled cheese, you'd expect there to be cheese on the sandwich...Correct? This was an extremely disappointing visit to the Yard. I've been to this location before with no complaints, but multiple people in my group were not satisfied with the service or how their order came out. I don't think I'll be returning as it's clear things have really gone downhill.

0AX__JMZge0QF4fmVEZkxw.text: This was amazing! The Buffy the Mac Slayer was delicious, as was the Always Sunny in Philadelphia. It was exactly what we were looking for! We will definitely check it out next time we are in town !

yzoHRWOyNRSR2hPI1Gf_dg.text: We had a great time here on New Years Eve. Our server Autumn made the night so fun. She was very attentive and helpful. Her vibrant personality kept us laughing all night. The drink specials were fantastic and we loved the appetizers. We will be back soon.

nTkID57qD__X4qjt1b-waw.text: Very good food and once we ordered,  it came out quickly. The problem was that they asked if we had reservations,  which we didn't. They said it was a 45 minute wait even though they had plenty of empty tables waiting for reservations which apparently didn't show. So crazy. So many people turned away for nothing.   We ended up at one of the reserved tables that wasn't filled.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Simple Jack with a side of tomato soup and garlic parmesan fries.

bA_otzOKXjefevDiFRiYTw.text: The menu is rather limited, you have to be hungry for a cheese sandwich. There are a few burgers and a few sides, but that is pretty much it.   Menu aside, the service is below average.  Hostess was taking us to our table and said wait here right in the middle of the restaurant. Came back about four minutes later and seated us - not sure what happened.   After that our waitress was adequate at best, had to ask other servers if they could send her over, no follow up, etc.  And the appetizers came out with the meal so a ton of food all at once.    Last thing is the beer list was alphabetical, not by type/style. Made it hard to find a beer.

Old_9SjcLqjBpIUvlS4UTg.text: The yard was a really good experience. Went here with a few guys to break my fast with half off grilled cheese! Got the Daniel lafferty and it was delicious! The fries on the side were also really good and our waiter, John was really friendly and accommodating as we waited to finish up our fast. Will be there again

0WQ6DHwVjeoCN8sB3CeLEg.text: Before actually trying The Yard I had heard so many great things about it. I had the big Chebowski (a bacon egg and cheese) with the tomato soup and mac and cheese as sides. The sandwich itself lived up to the hype. It was delicious and my egg was nice and runny just how I asked for it. The tomato soup was typical tomato soup, good but nothing life changing. The mac and cheese was underwhelming-it was kind of bland.  I would go again but I would get different sides. There is a huge selection of sandwiches and sides to choose from, its tough for an indecisive person. Overall I had a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hfN9iuN7qe0mi5qLMGbddw.text: On a diet and hoping to keep the calorie count low? Look much further--The Yard is not the place for you. The food mostly revolves around different variations of the classic grilled cheese+tomato soup combo. The food was messy and filling but quite salty. This is also not the place if you were hoping to get a good conversation in. The music and surroundings were quite loud when I went. Overall, I would only go again with friends I see often for an indulgent weekend meal.

HNbUJJuyLS4Zpgdg7VIoYw.text: Food is really awesome! Loved the pretzels, brunch burrito, and the French toast with Nutella and bananas. So good! Staff was nice too :)

HdUmbJ--SDYShBtOQh1aEw.text: Up until now I've heard many good things about the Yard so we were very excited to try it....needless to say I wont be back!! The overall appearance and layout of the restaurant was ok, music was good, and my waiter was really nice....thats about as good as it gets. I got the staple mac & cheese grilled cheese sandwich with fries and the tomato soup. The food came out in a timely manner however it just was not what I expected. Most photos from The Yard the food looks amazing...my food however did not. My bread was so hard and inside of my sandwich (mac and cheese) was luke warm, French fries were greasy with absolutely no seasoning on them, and the tomato soup was meh. But I ate it anyway because I was starving ! An hour later my friend and I are both extremely nauseated and begin vomiting.....there goes our night SMH! What a coincidence we eat that food and an hour later we are both hugging the toilet. Because of that The Yard gets one star & won't be getting my business again!!
