1LkX0dLvRwua3tNXj5J-Ww.text: I can't say enough good things about Chuck and the staff at The Yard. We had my son's wedding reception in their upstairs space, Coaches. The food and service was excellent. They were more than accommodating with our decorating and special requests. Chuck was prompt and professional with correspondence throughout our preparations. I HIGHLY recommend them if your looking for a beautiful space with incredible food and a lot of bang for your buck!!

ZHtGQJvZHgE2Lz_n2P6gZA.text: This was one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten. All those custom grilled cheeses mmmmmm. I got the Always Sunny in Philadelphia. I want another so bad. This place has an awesome atmosphere too with a pool table, darts, two floors. I loved it. Can't wait to be back!

-wV3gMAPFh8o_UXADjyZlQ.text: I feel like The Yard is one of those places where it often flies under your radar when deciding to look for a place to eat out in a particular part of town. This restaurant is tucked behind Walnut street and is pretty easy to overlook. However, make sure to check this place out next time you're on Walnut street- it's worth the visit!  Living about a five minute walk from the Yard, I have been there several times and every single time I have been impressed by their service and food. One of the things I love about the Yard is that they have a wonderful beer list with a lot of variety. I always love trying out beers I've never had before and the Yard is a wonderful place to expand your beer palette.  My most recent visit to the Yard, I ordered the Mac Attack grilled cheese with garlic fries and tomato soup. The grilled cheese was served very generously with more than enough mac and cheese to fill up on, which made for a messy (yet delicious!) meal. The fries were also great as well. The only item that I wasn't too crazy about was the tomato soup, which had almost an acidic taste to it. All in all, I always enjoy visiting the Yard and always leave satisfied with a food coma!

ml9mfigVrbk8x-xQ6rivhA.text: Food was fantastic. Our server not so much... Had to flag her down for drinks and she never came back to check on our table after we got our food. Nice place though, will be back.

Qd1hVBuhyM0lXzzfYPvhig.text: A group of us decided to head up on a Friday for happy hour around 6pm.  Three of us showed up originally and we expected five, so they sat us at one of the tables in the bar area.  More and more people joined us, and our final group was about eight.  It was a bit tight, but they were willing to make it work.  That said, I would still recommend making reservations so you can get a table in the dining area and you won't need to worry about huddling around a small table.    Their beer list is fairly lengthy.  Unfortunately it seemed like they were out of everyone in our group's first choice of beer.  When ordering drinks it's definitely worth having a back up ready just in case they're running low again.  As far as food you have to with one of their many grilled cheese options.  I got the Mac Attack, a grilled cheese sandwich with macaroni and cheese.  It was delicious, cheesy goodness (with way too many carbs).  It came with fires and some tomato soup.  They go well with the sandwich, although I can't recommend dipping a Mac Attack into your soup.  It will probably not hold up.  The wait staff was friendly and willing to accommodate our group as more people showed up than expected.  They were willing to work with us and tried to find us a bigger table, even while dealing with reservations.  That was nice, even if it didn't work out for us.  All in all, it's a great place to go with friends after work.  I'll keep it in mind for the next time we decide to do a post-work happy hour.

9unoG6avjvTZ6fEj3X4ukA.text: So we were 5 minutes away and I thought about calling to get our name on the list early.  I called and they don't take phone reservations, which is fine, but they said there is no wait right now.  5 minutes later, I see two couples sitting down and the hostess tells me there will be about a 30 minute wait but we can go to the bar.  I walk to the bar and see half of the restaurant empty.  From all of the oddness already, I decided to go to BRGR instead.  I ate at the Yard before and was only going because my friend suggested it.  Never was a fan though.  Very dingy and the food is gross.  Do not recommend.

G433nWpQ61P_hx-iKm6Y5A.text: Came here on a Monday for their grilled cheese special with a group of 7. They sat us in this weird dark corner, probably because they were (to my surprise since it was a Monday) quite busy.  They seemed to have a nice beer selection, although I can't comment on them much since I got a cider.  For appetizers we got pretzels and the poutine. The pretzels were your typical type and the poutine had melted cheese instead of cheese curds and was super heavy but tasty.  For my sandwich I got the Wang Chung Tonight on recommendation from our waiter. It was DELICIOUS. I had the biggest smile on my face after trying it. The sandwich itself was huge with buttery bread. It was paired with the parm herb fries which were also very flavorful and tasty. I wasn't the biggest fan of the tomato soup - too salty for me and had some chunks in it.  The Breakfast Club and the Big Chewbowski were hits with my dinner mates. We also tried a side of mac and cheese that was super cheesy and super yummy.  Would def come back here again, they have specials almost every night and for the amount of food with the Monday special it was extremely affordable. Eight of us ate for about $120 (including drinks).

BKKPSHg-ycbL-NNgoHBb-g.text: Anywhere where I can get a menu of grilled cheese and beer is a place I want to be.  Yet another favorite spot in Pittsburgh!  Mmm cheese...  I know it's hard to find parking in Shadyside, but there is fair priced garage next door to make your visit that much more convenient and enjoyable.  My friends and I decided to grab a drink and dinner after work.  After seeing the "Gobbler" on The Yard's Facebook page, we knew it was time to visit.  While I waited for everyone to arrive, I ordered their hot pretzels.  Oh my gosh were they hot and tasty!  They came with a honey mustard and a spicy mustard - both were delicious.  The pretzels paired with my craft beer nicely!  For my main course, I selected the Big Che-bowski - Cheddar / Smokin Rodeo Gouda / Thick Applewood Smoked Bacon / Fried Egg / Tomato.  Are you drooling yet?  I was!  Accompanied by sweet potato fries, I left saying "I can't believe I ate the whole thing..."    There are many other cheesy dishes I want to try: TURKEY CRISTO = Swiss / Tussy Mountain Cheese / Oven Roasted Turkey / Berry Preserves / Deep Fried,  or WANG CHUNG TONIGHT = Smokin Rodeo Gouda / Pan Fried Chicken / Asian Slaw / Sweet Thai Chili Sauce, or basically anything on their menu.  Yes, The Yard left an impression and all I want is CHEESE!  or BEER!  Or BOTH :)

8tv0G3fHgbovDTPWSDQqYg.text: We stopped in for drinks after dinner cause we were curious.  The pub and restaurant are downstairs.  The place just opened and is very clean.  The drink menu was creative and extensive.  There is something for everyone on the menu.  I was only going to have one drink but...the first drink was so good and i was so intrigued by some of their offerings I had to try another.  It was worth it!   The service was really, really good.  I mean really good.  Just how you want it to be- friendly, attentive but not too attentive or too friendly.  Our server gave us honest and good recommendations.  Also, the hostess was friendly.    We didn't order food this time- we do plan to go back.  Just from observation, the burgers looked great.  And tons of folks were ordering them.  I'll review than next time I guess.   I would recommend this place.

8ARWUM7uzYYhFmCftjtARw.text: In a hunt for someplace casual to grab a bite to eat and hang out on a Friday night, we discovered The Yard. Overall, I would say it offers reasonably priced, Pittsburgh-esqe food but with a bit more flair. People coming here should expect a cozy ambience and comfort food best served on a cold winter evening.   Ambience: The restaurant is located, more or less, in the basement of a building just off of Walnut. The large chalkboards covered with specials and beers on tap along with incandescent lighting make it an approachable place. The only downside I imagine is during the day, where being below street level offers little lighting. On a Friday evening, the place was busy- great for a group of friends, less so for a romantic date.  Food: I went for one of their grilled cheeses (Smack Yo Mama) and was by no means disappointed. The Texas toast was thick cut and butter generously. The cheese oozed out. As I said before, this place offers meals for the gluttonous not healthy. I was a big fan of the sweet potato fries (although a bit more seasoning or salt would have been nice) and the side of cinnamon butter (or cream?) was perfect. The tomato soup on the side was an added bonus. Overall I was pleased as were my friends, but again, expect to feel the impending coma. And of course, the added flair of the food led to a slightly higher price than you would expect from a grilled cheese ($11-14), although after eating it, I wouldn't complain.   Drinks: Like many establishments, The Yard offered a wide selection of beers including some fantastic stouts. I would say the selection was above average but pricing a bit on the high side for Pittsburgh. Somewhere around $6-8/beer unless you went for the less appealing domestics.   Service: A bit slow on a busy Friday night and things were crammed by the bar. But once we were seated, we had quick and friendly service. The waiter offered his recommendations which were spot on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smack Yo Mama with sweet potato fries. Coma inducing deliciousness...

nRICqGrWnf8JSeoDUzhx3g.text: Holy cow are my taste buds tired! A fine establishment nestled in a wonderful neighborhood. After watching Andy Warhol eat a hamburger at the museum and purchasing 5 new aprons from Williams and Sonoma (new year, new me!), it was safe to say that I had worked up quite an appetite. The lemon water that our server brought out was delicious and very flavorful. I had to watch myself, almost filled up on water.I chose a philly cheese type of grilled cheese..did I mention they have 28 different types? The philly cheese was just what the doctor ordered to combat my hunger, in addition to the succulent soup and zesty Cajun fries. This place is a gem and I plan on returning to Pittsburgh all of February and sample all 28 in 28 days. Easy 5 stars plus I'll give them 5 slices of cheese making this my favorite place of all time! Thanks!!!!!!!!!!!!

dlgP-XaCna77mzfxBs7LkQ.text: Two words: s'mores fondue. It was everything I wanted in life and more. The rest of the menu is pretty fancy and they have some great food but the lovely chocolate and marshmallow goodness of the s'mores fondue just filled my food-loving soul. Also a great selection of beers on tap; I've enjoyed all the stouts I have tried - personal favorite would be "Sweet Baby Jesus" a peanut butter and chocolate stout, which can do no wrong.   Trivia night has a great atmosphere! The hosts are enthusiastic and welcoming and do a good job of keeping the crowd happy and entertained.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate, marshmallow, graham crackers... Heaven.

D_tgPWh41IPvpexb8qdIGQ.text: When I heard about these gourmet grilled cheese, I HAD to try The Yard! I think my expectations were a bit too high, which is why they fell short a bit.   I was overwhelmed with the menu at first, but ended up going with what I came to get - The Mac Attack. When I saw it had bacon, I had to have it. I didn't know what "lardons" were, so I asked our server and he replied "little pieces of bacon". Sold. I ordered that with crispy fries and a $3 glass of wine, nice. The rest of the table ordered and one of our friends also got the Mac Attack (another bacon lover!).   It didn't take too long to come out and when it did I was so excited to try! I took my first bite and my taste buds were overly happy, but then slightly disappointed - no bacon. I asked the server if they forgot to put it in and he said "no, it's cooked in bacon, but there isn't actually bacon". What? Fifteen minutes ago you told me there were small pieces of bacon. Both my friend and I were extremely disappointed. Sans bacon, it was still delicious. This was a perfect grilled cheese to dip into the tomato soup. The fries however, eh. They are described as crispy, however mine were mostly made up of huge chunks of potatoes, so they weren't at all crispy.   Dessert - huge disappointment. Creme brulee is my favorite dessert and it just didn't do it for me at all. Maybe it was the white chocolate. S'mores fondue was bland and the graham crackers were stale.   Prices aren't bad at all for the amount of food you get. I didn't mind the restaurant being in the basement and didn't feel it took away from anything.   All in all, I still really enjoyed this restaurant and will definitely go back - way too many grilled cheeses to try!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. White Chocolate Creme Brûlée
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. S&#39;mores Fondue
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3OrsQrx_WLxmkeHMFuLI5A.text: Food was ok. My tots were kind of luke warm...had sat a while. But holy cow it was freeeeeeeeeeeezing in here. The entire restaurant has their hands between ther thighs to keep warm and i have my tossil cap on.  Please turn up...nay turn on the heat.

_lyQge0EcvIfw2mLfqqehg.text: I've walked by the yard and considered venturing in, but the location in the basement kept me from venturing in until today.    The decor is great--high ceilings, great looking bar, and everything feels easy and very casual--no blaring music at 6:30, just people talking.    Bartender was very nice and the guy next to me actually chatted, which is good for Shadyside.  Ordered the pierogis and kielbasa and it was AWESOME.  It came with kraut and grilled onions.  I loved it.    Highly recommend.

_wXnyZXK-sqR_QZzHuSA7A.text: Overall I had a really great experience. Good food, good beer, good service....BUT when we asked our server (who was so funny and nice) to have a shot with us, she refused. That's the only thing separating "The yard" from 5 stars.

sg8bd7cql01mhuG_FUsNAA.text: Great grilled cheese!  I love the sloppy, greasy, 'shrooms vegetarian grilled cheese  on thick-bread. Yum!  They have great fries and potato chips.  Try the sciracha ranch and dip your sandwich or chips In it.   I have also had the fattoush salad. This is a full salad at $11 with a very good lemony men dressing and general Middle Eastern flavors. It's a decent size. At the servers recommendation I got balsamic dressing on the side salad and although The dressing looked distressingly thick in its little cup, The flavor was very good. Others at my table got the cheesy caprese grilled cheese and we're happy with it, although one of them thought the sandwich needed more basil. The atmosphere Of the Shadyside location is kind of fun/warehous-y.  The diners were a welcome mix of all young and many races. I have always had good service here and find them to be quite flexible in accommodating requests.   One thing I would not recommend this restaurant for is people who have trouble hearing. The restaurant is quite noisy.  Otherwise if you're up for some tasty decadent food, this is probably your place

Id2UqqzbkqAyANX6BN6ytA.text: In the mood for comfort food, then The Yard is a solid choice. We've been twice now with out of town guests and our newborn, and besides accidentally spilling tomato soup on myself (klutz) have really enjoyed ourselves. I've gotten The Simple Jack and can't wait to try more of their grilled cheese options. The Mac Attack was also enjoyed by everyone at our table as a shared appetizer. One slight critique is that the tomato soups has a kind of smokey after taste, that's just not up my alley. It's perfectly fine for dipping sandwiches and fries, but eating it on it's own, not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Simple Jack grilled cheese and tomato soup.

XPj8YpY3faR14Oyl-RF8aw.text: Was very excited to try this place out after reading reviews online. I ordered the lafferty, Daniel which is a chicken parm sandwich. The chicken wasn't the best quality. The garlic parm fries didn't have much flavor. The tomato soup was probabaly the best out of everything, and I'm not a big fan of tomato soup to begin with.   My boyfriend got the Hail Caesar chicken sandwich and he agreed that the chicken looked a little "funny".   I'm curious about their grilled cheeses, so maybe I'll try it again. But I would not get any chicken sandwiches.

v-J3IKljJZgFmE9cKUlR6Q.text: It was okay. Not good, not great, just okay. To start the bottomless mimosas are$15 or $7 each, which personally is a little high. Bottomless Bloody Marys were$18 so my table and I opted out.   I had the frittata. It was okay but lacking a lot of seasoning. It is billed as having caramelized onions, basil, tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese. I assumed it would all be in the frittata. It was all just thrown on top. The home fries were standard cubed potatoes you could find anywhere.   My other friends at the breakfast burrito and the chorizo scramble. They were happy with their meals but the home fries were mediocre.   What really saved the meal was the waitress, Kara. She knew what we needed before we even realized it. Never pushy but very helpful. Do be forewarned that the place is very, very, very loud and the tables against the wall are very tight. Opt for a table by the booths for additional space. Brunch was just okay.

3zGjgaNLKBMKLTVrk2eZ7w.text: I've visited the Yard multiple times, but most recently for a girl's afternoon out for brunch. Came in on a Sunday morning on a barely needed reservation on OpenTable and were seated immediately at some high top tables. Our waiter was great (wish I remembered his name). He kept the drinks flowing but let us have the space to chat. As for the food, I went for the chicken and waffles sliders. They were to die for! The chicken was well seasoned and just greasy enough to satisfy. The gravy was well balanced and the home fries were perfectly crisp! I'd definitely recommend this spot to anyone.

_4yW7QSir6TD6W7B0bTdvg.text: Great spot for brunch! It was on the louder side which was just fine as we had two kids with us. My daughter said it was the best burger ever and I really enjoyed the Cheesy Capresey grilled cheese. And of course the bottomless mimosas were a great touch as well!

ejjq9iDxE2-PgtvkJZzk5A.text: I really wanted to try this place out while in Pittsburgh. Definitely not the kinda joint you can roll in with a stroller too. I'd say this place is totally not good for children.  Walked in and up to hostess stand. Was greeted awkwardly and I asked for a table for two and a high chair. The girl looked at me like I had three heads. She responded, "do you have a reservation"? I said no, didn't realize I had to even make one. She's like yeah we have no tables. I said ok, well what's the wait like. She then says  she'll check...oh boy I'm so grateful she decided to do her job. She said, about 25min. I said ok, put us down. They take down your number and text you once ready.  We wound up enjoying dinner in North Shore area which was a much more pleasant experience.

nVQusidBorkcE-Oue91OBw.text: Food selection is nice.  However, I came here with a group for a birthday celebration. Food came out cold, and portion wasn't very filling. The lettuce wraps should be on the appetizer portion of the menu, rather than the entree portion.  Service was ok... however I had to track a waitstaff member down to order a drink after being there for 45 minutes.   I would try the Yard again, but maybe order something else, and also not in a group.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lettuce Wraps with Steak and side of fries

dUj9EvQ5-4fRm_E3l81tdA.text: I visited from out of town while staying with my cousin and all I can say is I wish we had a place like this on LI! Everything was excellent. The beer menu was extensive and very descriptive. I had the Tropical IPA and was not disappointed. The menu was vast as well, and I liked how all grilled cheese came with a side of their tomato soup which was excellent. All grilled cheese also comes with a side of home made potato chips, but you can sub for another side, such as flavored French fries as I did. I got the Parmesan garlic fries, and could have done without the powdered flavoring, but the rest of the meal was so good I didn't mind. I got the Mac Attack sandwich-grilled cheese stuffed with creamy Mac and cheese and it was one of the best sandwiches I ever had. I wish we weren't so full so that I could have tried their dessert! Our waitress was very friendly and conversational.   I can't wait to come back when I visit Pitt again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac attack grilled cheese with Parmesan garlic fries and tomato soup!

dy5yclXJ3DiQ1PriUMNpLg.text: Came here on Thursday night after 9 pm for their half off grilled cheese. It is such a good deal! My friends had the cheesy caprese, while I had the mac attack. The mac attack was amazing. Their mac and cheese is creamy and delicious. The bacon lardons are pockets of crunchy, meaty, goodness. It was delicious! The chips were nothing special. Mine were kind of burnt. Their tomato soup is nice for dunking the ends of the sandwich. My friends loved their caprese sandwich as well. Overall, an excellent option to satisfy any grilled cheese craving.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Mac attack!!!
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac attack

P8fOURDioSa6pFzBQabyTQ.text: Everything was amazing! The service, the food, the drinks. The Grilled cheese sandwiches are limitless. And the tomato soup that came with it was the best I ever had. Check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LZPnA5cKAMiURCm64fgrbA.text: I've been a fan of this place since it's opening in Shadyside a few years ago. Unique, grilled cheese with everything from sweet & tangy BBQ pulled chicken to strawberry onion jam make this place a must-go whenever you're in Pittsburgh. The service was awesome during Friday happy hour and the specials are unmatched: half off apps and drafts Mon-Fri 3-7! I recommend the Pub Pretzels and the Wac Arnold! Can't wait to go back a try a new grilled cheese combo.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2AjcRYItkplJw9SIA1C57A.text: Best food deals!! The grilled cheeses are delish but definitely go for a wing night, best wing deals I've seen in Pittsburg. The poutine with pork is also amazing.  Love the manager- so sweet and friendly!

cVAQuwlGbImq8auLIVtf8w.text: Love this place I have been here many times with friends no one was ever disappointed.  The Bloody Mary is fantastic! I had The Always Sunny in Philadelphia (see picture) it was delicious. Staff always nice and even fun. I will go back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6-p1aiqSeBy6PsMf2b1-ug.text: Sad I feel the need to write this, as I used to love this place (the food and beer selection is great). However, last time there had the worst service I think I've ever experienced...anywhere.  First, waited for 25 minutes at the bar before I even got a water. There was also a mess - an old half eaten Mac and cheese, some drinks and someone's check sat there with me the whole time. Then put my name in for a table, and waited another 20 min while I watched four tables sit empty and the hosts chatted with their friends. When I finally asked if I could sit at one of the open tables, they said they had tried texting me it was ready but they had bad service (I was sitting 5 feet from the host stand).  After finally getting to a table and waiting another few minutes without anyone approaching me to take an order, and having so far spent 45 minutes to get a water, I finally left to get some food across the street.   So, unfortunately I won't be coming back, because as much as I did like the food here, it only tastes good if you ever actually get it.

kJFtsUMV4OXeEziMT0E3kw.text: Everyone I know has been telling me that I need to try this place and I absolutely LOVED it. I went with a group of friends for a 21st birthday celebration and it was perfect because of the large selection of alcohol and music. The service was a little slow, but our waitress was very friendly and very welcoming!!   I got the "Smack Yo Mama" grilled cheese which consisted of beer cheese, onion rings, and BBQ chicken. It was delicious and to die for. With the recommendation of my friends (which I now also encourage), I substituted my side of homemade potato chips for sweet potato fries (at an extra cost) and they were delicious as well. They don't skimp on anything and although the price can be a little steep; I would say that the food is definitely worth it. The rest of my group got the "Mac Attack" grilled cheese and they loved it! I would definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Smack Yo Mama&#34; grilled cheese

D3cLC2kwEx5qb3OzohPfVA.text: It's so sad what's happened to The Yard. I used to enjoy coming here, but it's taken a sharp turn down.  I've been twice in the past week and each time it's taken about 35-50 minutes to receive food after ordering. After the first time, I assumed they were having a rough day, but on the 2nd time, I realized it's because their kitchen is swamped by Uber eats or Grubhub orders and can't turn out food for the restaurant.   We were also seated on the bar side for one of the meals and while the bartender was nice, she was left to cover the entire side by herself. At one point 3 servers and the hostess were joking around at the bar, while we were unsuccessfully trying to get our check.   Sadly, I don't expect we'll be back.

GjND3aSR3-PnT9jWoyruMA.text: I came here the first really cold weekend of the year and got the Macaroni grilled cheese with tomato soup.  I highly recommend it.  It's also in a cool spot in shadyside that is good to walk around for sight seeing.

kAH_2FjFnSt3SPgPKaOEUA.text: As a lover of grilled cheese, I knew I would find my home here. Originally a vegetarian, I tested their veg options and always enjoyed what I had. Now a meat eater, I've been getting their "The Big Che-Bowski", and it does not disappoint. They do not skimp on bacon, and they definitely don't skimp on cheese. Every sandwich is loaded and delicious, especially with the edition of the Texas toast. We have always had great experiences here, with only minor complaints (a friend ordered onion rings last weekend and the insides of a few were still mushy batter) but overall, a great place, and a great atmosphere.   We ordered it to go via grubhub last night. Usually we call, but it went straight to a voicemail every time I tried to call, so I went online and hoped they would get our orders right--I'm always afraid that if I say I don't want something in the "special comments" section, it might be ignored. Our food was all correct. The tomato soup was dished into the container just before I took it home, and was still nice and warm. Our only complaint was that the Texas toast was a bit too hard, and not in a "crispy" way. We noticed this last weekend, as well. But by the end of our meals, we were full and happy and ready to binge Netflix on the couch!

Nd-2scS05vsi5dDVr0mbug.text: I LOVE THE YARD! I always get the "Smack yo mama" which is a grilled cheese with pulled bbq chicken and beer cheese and fried onions. Its delicious if youre a fan of bbq. The atmosphere is great and im pretty sure they have half off on monday nights (?) not 100% sure but they definitely have half off one of the days. They also have good brunch and bottomless mimosas! 10/10 would recommend.

IF3l4OhUabLtssCcE45mOg.text: Loved it.  Went in for Happy Hour Friday night and brunch the next morning.  Great beer selection with very knowledgeable staff. The happy hour prices were really good in the happy hour food was excellent. Loved the bloody Mary bar at brunch and the food was again excellent.

XpDVppZp3BGwBsOR3yapRQ.text: Atmosphere was casual and relaxed, with a hipster feel. Bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's are a draw.   Their special grilled cheeses are awesome. Tried the sweet fries and slaw - slaw was a special recipe that wasn't my style, but good.  A great place to stop when in Shadyside.

xi_X4Vk5EOZ5GuFi1lIOuw.text: I've been here several times.  For brunch, lunch, dinner, and just for a drink or two.  At best, it seems like the wait staff or bartender is... barely concerned about the guests.  I don't need much attention...but also don't like sitting at the bar trying to get the bartenders attention when there are 2 people there.  Hell, it seems like even the table wait staff are frustrated with the bartenders.  I've seen a couple trying to order drinks....and eventually give up and walk away.   Wings are just Ok.   Brunch items (at least our two) are... sad, to say the least.  The Brun-Cho's Bro is essentially a bowl of tater tots with some cheese and canned jalapenos.  Mimosas are pretty weak.    Dear owners:. You are paying premium rent/mortgage, hire enough people!

ftgdIs-2X9WAYRQm__BR3A.text: This place has the most unique grilled cheese sandwiches! Not only are the names funny, but the fillings for each grilled cheese are super interesting. Our waitress was super friendly and the food came after a reasonable amount of time. I ordered Frank the Tank (chicken wing dip and onion rings), which came with a side of tomato soup and chips (or fries). The grilled cheese was delicious, however I downgraded this to a four star because all my friends agreed that the sandwich was way too salty.  I'd definitely come back, but be prepared to drink a lot of water!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frank the Tank with Cajun fries and tomato soup
Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frank the Tank

4InBXVKGAngfeEtNZmq9yQ.text: We tried the chorizo scramble which was recommended to us. It was terrible...very dry and no flavor. Also, it did not taste like chorizo.  We also tried the wake and bake grilled cheese, which tasted fine, but the tomato soup was also flavorless.

ddthR8EOGBIbC8xTMvtClg.text: Came in on a Monday night last week after making a reservation on Yelp. Heard good things from friends about their half-off grilled cheese specials. Had the smack-yo-mama grilled cheese paired with jerk seasoned fries. It was delicious and our server was very attentive although I could tell he was swamped. The tomato soup that comes with the meal was a little lack luster and I could really do without it. Don't live in the area but would come back and try something else next time I'm in the area.

zT0h7UhpM6O68RIO_tVmFQ.text: We went for the Saturday brunch and sat at the bar. The bar is oddly high and the chairs not so much so it gave us a bit of an Alice in Wonderland vibe.  Bottomless mimosas were great despite being illegal.  Brunch menu was just okay. Steel Cactus brunch is better. They both open at 10 on Saturday mornings.

-7ktm8gXjwDsxHoPuFX4Pg.text: Went back with some friends to give it another go. The food came out much quicker but the service was still lacking. I hate having to ask for drink refills. Hopefully the service can catch up to the pretzel appetizer. When we were there, still wasn't a kids menu.

H0fdAr310TAFEW4SV1TpJA.text: I went there with my girlfriends for Sunday brunch.  The coffee was absolutely HORRIBLE! much worst that the instant coffee that I make in the office. surprisingly our waitress knew that the coffee is bad, and she said it is not a good coffee, and she apologized that she could not do anything about it.  I got chorizo scramble. It was OK, nothing special. and certainly not spicy enough. The grilled cheese that my friends had were greasy.  The bottomless mimosas were mostly juice. One of my friends bough one regular mimosa ($7), which had a much better quality.  Anyways, not impressed at all!

9Kwk-p4BliPfLgDn1aNU2A.text: Bbq pulled pork with siracha slaw and onion straws, nothing better. Oh wait, maybe the sweet potatoe waffle fries, with honey butter dipping sauce. My goodness this place is a food paradise, they really only make a few select dishes, mainly burgers, and grilled cheese. But what they make, they make out of this world, will definitely come back.

KPmavItEb7PluXMEyJ6Msw.text: After my first visit to The Yard (Shadyside), I have since tried it on two more occasions with different groups of friends, and I think that my first visit was just a fluke in the service.  Both of my subsequent visits had excellently attentive and friendly service, and we tried different sandwiches both times, all of them delicious (granted, it is HEAVY food, but you don't go looking for a grilled cheese restaurant if you're trying to keep your diet for the night).  Glad that I gave them another chance, and now I would certainly recommend them.

mDClH9ZKLO2t4snIoyqGwg.text: I actually really enjoy this place. It's comfort food, plain and simple. You won't feel great about eating it, but you won't feel terrible either (go to Uncle Sam's for that). They've mastered the gourmet grilled cheese. Every sandwich comes with fries (which taste hand-cut) and tomato soup. Both are very good (although I've heard people complain that the soup tastes sour). All this for as low as $9. Probably the best deal on Walnut St. Definitely recommend.

MFeVTUU5ACTIabRgtCYTEQ.text: I would just like to go on the record that I was horribly disappointed with The Yard. The grilled cheese were too much stuff and not enough cheese. The soup on the side with Progresso tomato soup. The servers were scattered and horrible, but I suspect that was because they were clearly rotating the whole restaurant and it was just way too much for them to handle. I didn't see a manager or anyone who seemed to be in charge at any point. Generally it was just chaos. All around disappointing.

O1pl4uDfhBTSKUsEqs4Qkw.text: My friend and I had the yard-cho's bro, the crabby patty and seafood Mac and cheese. Everything was good- nothing to rave about, but I would go back and try it again. I enjoy places that have a large menu for me to pick from. They had so many grilled cheese I wanted to try it was hard to choose! Great prices for everything you get as well, soup and fries included. I'm not sure how new this place is but I definitely think the dining area could have been more decorated. It was very plain. The bar area looked fun though! I almost wish we got to sit there.

uOuxLbHKhRn3qASi5Bdz4A.text: I took Muffin, Killer and his girl to The Yard mid-week for dinner. Got there just before the evening rush. There was a little confusion getting us seated. (It's amazing how important those first few minutes are to set the tone for the whole evening.) The atmosphere was a little dark and loud. Not a to of personality. Then we got to the food. We ordered Poutine for an appetizer. I am not sure how they make their fries, but they are delicious. Think Steak Fry mates with Curly Fry. The Stout Gravy was perfectly seasoned and left you with a touch of pepper taste. They used a cheese sauce instead of actual curds which was a little disappointing, but the rest of the dish made up for it. Muffin and I decided to split 2 sandwiches since everything sounded so good. The Jerk did a great job of balancing all of the different flavors (Jerk Pork, Peach Chutney, Slaw) though now looking at the menu, I seemed to have missed the plantains. I had the Young Cheezy. The Chorizo was tasty and not too greasy. I think I could have done without the Hash, the texture kind of screwed up an otherwise great sandwich. Both plates came with more of those spectacular fries and a small bowl of Tomato Soup (The tomato soup, with it's hint of basil left me wondering how they got it to taste like the essence of summertime beefsteak tomatoes.) Killer pronounced his Mac Attack as yummy. High praise indeed from him. He even made a solid attempt to eat it all. Finally, against my better judgement we ordered "Cause We Got High" as dessert. We were all full, but how do you pass up a Peanut Butter, Banana, Nutella Sandwich that is deep-fried and covered with Toasted Marshmallow Fluff? When it came to the table, I suddenly understood why gluttony is a sin. You could feel how wrong it was to eat this down to your bones. That didn't stop us from devouring it all however.  All in all, the food was awesome and the service had a few kinks, that a little more direction and focus should be able to iron out.

cMss7mXiHwM8H66t6v2OaA.text: My friends and I stopped by The Yard on a weekend night and had a blast here. The waiter indulged our joking ways and found my friend the Yard glass for his Yuengling. All of us ordered food and was not disappointed. Awesome pub food at an affordable place. It has become one of my friends' go places in Shadyside!

DXakYFv2wqGmv6OAdsXTJg.text: OMG! Delicious comfort food. The grilled cheese is amazing. We had the Mac and cheese grilled cheese and the pierogies n at. Grilled cheese. Both were delicious! My only complaint (if it can even be a complaint) is that it was too large. I would prefer a half sandwich option especially since each sandwich comes with a small cup of tomato soup and fries. Again, delicious, but a little overboard.

Sm_aiYNhTixiq6MzLeBkKw.text: Great food, great draft list over all amazing place. Trivia on Wednesday is amazing and fun. The grill cheeses are amazing and the pub pretzels are a must

WwtYkWPYUfvNR86E6_LeCQ.text: First off, I REALLY enjoyed my grilled cheese topped with mac and cheese, as well as the deep fried soft pretzel sticks with beer cheese. (Yes, I like cheese). Our server was also very friendly and attentive. With that said, we happened along while a group was in the bar area, watching a Pirates game...the moment we walked in the door, someone dropped their yard of beer to the floor, so we opted to sit in the "dining" area. We were put at a table that looks out into the vestibule area/stairs that lead up to the street. If the crowd had been a bit more mellow, we probably would have eaten in the bar area, where there was a bit more ambiance. But, hey, it was our choice. We did enjoy the food, and I wouldn't be against going there again, if the opportunity presented itself!

mhbmCp5dx-i6M95EsbMt-g.text: Really good place to go if you're looking to have some comfort food and beers, they have great selection and good appetizers too. Price is good and friendly staff, pretty packed and busy on weekends and happy hours, you have to stand for quiet awhile until you make your way in but worth the try.

WIBOHRQ86qrEQeDltxaNRQ.text: A great beer list, a whole page of grilled cheese options, and a great location: what more could you want?  To actually be served. I came in on a Tuesday around 8:30 pm to a fairly empty bar and sat at one of the tables within the bar. Waited 15 minutes for service, made eye contact with the 3-4 waiters working, and no one came to our table to give us menus. We left shortly after that to go elsewhere.  It's unfortunate because I've had a decent experience before and truly enjoyed their food. It will be a while before I try The Yard again.

neU_02nuiun_8-H6sqfU8g.text: My friends and I visited The Yard for a girls night out, and we really enjoyed ourselves.  It was very crowded and we had to wait for over an hour to get a table, but we just ordered drinks at the bar and hung out while we waited.  Once we were seated, our service was good.  Our drinks and food were prepared pretty quickly.  The grilled cheese I ordered was excellent!  Almost all of the grilled cheese options sounded delicious, so it was a difficult decision,  but I chose the Mac Attack, and I'm so happy that I did!  I will be coming back....hopefully on a less popular night next time!

410ElCqjWe2rbnRrLE35Yg.text: Good variety of craft beers with the option for beer flights. Extensive grilled cheese menu - some very creative choices. I had the Frank the Tank, and I enjoyed it very much! We plan to visit again, and I'm excited to try a different grilled cheese sandwich!

mvs9rx9sMQiMpHIsvemurQ.text: It was my first time there and I've had a craving for mimosas for a few months now.  One of my friends kept posting about this restaurant and their bottomless mimosas on Saturday and Sunday.  The mimosas are from 10am to 1pm for $15 and it's definitely worth it.  The food is cooked beautifully.  I went there with family today and watched some football.  The owner did something extremely nice and I'll definitely be back because of the excellent customer service that was displayed! I would recommend for others to try it out.

UBXDNUOj09_siKky5zBkiw.text: Had dinner with my wife here on Sunday, the wait staff was friendly but inattentive. We started with drinks, wife had a red wine i had a whiskey. The wine was good, the whiskey pore was so small that I thought they gave me somebody's glass that had already drank from it ($9.50) the wine was $11.00 a glass, I bought a bottle today at the wine store for $9.99.   The food came, I had the Wang Chung grilled cheese but it had no cheese, the fries came in a little bucket that made they mushy. My wife's sandwich was better but not a gourmet grill cheese.   Will not waist my money or time here again. YUCK!

YoSzjpPNptdVjRID6H3pwg.text: Awesome beer selection, I love the layout of their draft menu. Some food items are for stoners but still look interesting. We got soup, flatbread, lettuce wraps, perogies, and pulled pork sliders-all were amazing except the flatbread.   The place is really loud. I enjoyed that, but just so you know.

MqiISihGDOvLS4o6VznqQg.text: I gave it a 4 star for one reason, way to loud. Food and service were amazing. They are know for there gourmet grill cheese sandwiches which we both ordered and they were awesome. Came with choice of french fries and tomato soup. We chose the sweet potato fries. Great. Will go back again but not at a time when the bar is packed. Would like to be able to hear each other talk.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wang Chung grilled cheese sandwich with sweet potato fries and tomato soup.

aYnoMuLTB4f-C-S2WKmCMQ.text: Used to really love this place, but definitely not as good as it used to be. No longer give u fries with grilled cheese anymore, now u get some mediocre potato chips. Grilled cheeses just aren't as delicious. It's still a cool concept but certainly not dying to go back.

5IsY2BLQEiaPLM5C-bV93A.text: I came to the Yard on a Friday night with a fairly large party. We called ahead to make reservations, and the staff was very accomodating when I changed the number of people the day of. The dining area is small, so I recommend reservations for large parties. We arrived a little early expecting to sit at the bar for a bit, but our table was all set up.  The interior is brand new and looks really nice. I barely noticed that the restaurant is in the basement and doesn't have much natural light.  Now, on to the most important part: the food. There is a rather extensive menu of grilled cheese. I had the Yinz Guys Hungry? which comes with steak, tomato, slaw, and cheese, but I ordered it without the slaw (born and raised in Pgh, yet I don't do slaw on sandwiches). All grilled cheese sandwiches come with a side of tomato soup and fries with your choice of seasoning. Delicious. Everyone else enjoyed theirs as well.  The menu also includes brunch, a burger or two, etc. I don't drink beer, but they have a lot of it, as well as a mixed drink and dessert drink menu. I had the DJ Razzy something or other and it was also delicious.  My only gripe with the Yard is the noise level. It was crowded and the noise bounces off the walls. We had to practially shout to hear each other.  But other than that, I definitely recommend the Yard.

XeAIrhZu68qbiVyGc_o_lg.text: They got a good selection of beers which I find it refreshing. Their food selection is also good very cheap but very tasty.  Services in general very good sometimes off.

d4LQ7p6wedA0WwnJEDYcWA.text: I love The Yard their food good, they have a different take of the standard grilled cheese. I am not from the area and try to stop in when near. We went on a Tuesday for lunch around 12:00 and they were closed. According to the info online they are to be open? My first dissapointed visit.

TJlE5fmcBpZeamfKTFNRng.text: Was just at The Yard yesterday with a friend. We came in later in the afternoon, an hour or two before the dinner rush. We sat at the bar, there was plenty of room there at the time, although not before long it was getting pretty busy. Overall we had a pretty great experience!   The bartender was nice and helpful, she seemed busy but did a good job of continuing to check on us. (Didn't catch her name but she was the only one there at the time.) She knew a great deal about craft beers--we were a bit overwhelmed at first, this place has 30+ beers on tap, many that I had never heard of. She asked us what we like to drink, recommended a couple for us to try, and helped us find ones that we really liked! I was happy we could get some insight and to get to try something before committing. My friend (who knows even less than I about beer) was excited to have found two new beers she really liked!   We split some appetizers, had the pretzels which were a great portion, served hot with yummy dipping sauces. My friend got the crab soup, she wasn't thrilled with it, but with the other stuff we ordered we had plenty to eat anyhow. She did not realize it was so cheesy, as that wasn't indicated on the menu. We also had a flatbread pizza which was very good. The food took a while, but outside of the wait and the soup we were quite pleased with what we got.   My experience at The Yard was very pleasant. I can't speak to any of the more substantial meals or table service since we were at the bar, however, based on the hospitality, beer selection, and value/quality of what we ordered I am sure I will be back sometime soon!

3jYvGDgi7pLuSFEqeKFhxw.text: Greasy faux rustic bar.  Decent beer selection.  nachos are good but the wings (one of their specialties) not so much. 2.5 stars is probably a more accurate rating.

mD1_4KdSo-UyIEp1IX_qEw.text: This was the second bad experience I've had at the yard. The first time, long story short, they were unable to give me a grilled cheese that had melted cheese. Me and two friends go there for brunch. First, we couldn't get Mimosa's where you could taste the chamagne. Next, the chorizo aka dog food. Two of us had it. I asked for new food. The manager, rather than just apologizing told us "all taste buds are different". They told me they took it off my check. I then get a check from the third waiter we had that day. I asked to see the manager again. The manager and owner came up. Rahter than apologizing for the bad experience, he lectured us on how its his best seller. Side note- the guests behind us had the chorizo and sent it back too. I don't appreciate being lectured when I am not happy with my food.

L1c-J5TFJszKmZPe-BCjxg.text: This was our second time here, and I am so glad I waited to form an opinion on this place. We were here for dinner on the 4th with our good friend Todd, and had a wonderful meal! The first time around it was kind of ho-hum, but I think it was more a matter if ambiance than food. See, the BF and I are not loud-bar-raucous-crowd types of people. We're more like to stare-lovingly-into-each-other's-eyes-while-sharing-one-drink-with-two-big-straws type of people. But the first time there, it was later in the evening, with the music pumping and lots of college aged people. So the morale is, if your old(ish) and boring choose when you go wisely, and you will have a lovely time! The first time I tried one of their grilled cheese and BF had a cheeseburger. Both were good, although I found the grilled bread kind of...sharp? I guess that's the right word. However the fries were really good and the homemade tomato soup is out of this world.  This time we started with the pub pretzels which I thought were going to be boring, but turned out pretty good.  I had a hamburger- the basic Yard burger, the BF had the Buffalo burger and Todd had the pulled pork sandwich. Everything was delicious! As I said, mine was basic but done well. Cooked well, juicy, on a great bun; a really good hamburger. Todd was pretty darn impressed with his BBQ, but, for me, the star of the show was the Buffalo burger. I never thought I'd like buffalo, but it was really, really good! I almost can't wait to go back so I can have one myself. The have a few style fries, regular, old bay and a couple others. All the fries are hand cut and very good. Although I'm a fry junky so.... Both times, the service was good. OBV, the service was unbelievable this time around, as we were one of like 4 tables in the whole place, but even the first time, when our waitress was running around like crazy, the service was good. Overall, I was very happy and can't wait to go back (for a super early, 5:30pm old person dinner, but, whatever!)

KWInvcRlCac1eoTiQU1kVQ.text: I've been here twice and definitely won't be going back.  I tried to give it a second chance but it wasn't worth it.  The food, while it looks good, is bland.  The grilled cheeses are overrated.  They can be soggy and not worth the price tag.  The tomato soup is the strangest I've ever tasted and not in a good way.  I would prefer Campbells.  The burgers look good when presented but again have no flavor.  The nachos with beer cheese were almost inedible.Some of the other sandwiches are all bread.  The sweet potato fries are good but that's the extent of it.  The $25 I spent on two beers and a sandwich could have been better served somewhere else.

V5RRfWomGYfs2rgjUGZ1QA.text: A good place to go for a great selection of craft beers, but the menu isn't that great in my opinion. The sandwiches are pretty expensive for something you could probably easily make yourself.  With that being said, if you do go here for food, be sure to go on a Monday for 1/2 off sandwiches from 7 to midnight and $4 pints. Also, I came here for some drinks with my friends for my birthday and my partner and I ordered a larger size quantity of beer to share. I don't remember how many ounces it was. I thought it would come in a large pitcher or something, but it came in a tall beer tower/tube looking thing (I cannot think of the actual word for this) and it was really hard to drink. It required a decent amount of concentration to not spill it when drinking, especially with the bubbles going on. Kids these days. Generally, I like my beer in a straightforward glass or pitcher of some kind.

uJ6413o2_89kGspEmays8g.text: Had a philly cheese steak version of a grilled cheese. Not bad but the steak was just slightly chewy. Also had the garlic fries which had good flavor but not crispy enough. I normally do not like tomato soup but I enjoyed theres.

1dlgMU7ZEp-hdV578xhOFA.text: This place is great! The adult cream soda is my new favorite mixed drink and I absolutely loved their take on pulled pork. I've also tried 2 or 3 of the grilled cheeses and I've been totally satisfied. It can get pretty busy but the food and drinks are totally worth the wait. This is probably my favorite bar in Pittsburgh!

TmrVO7HehqpBjcRgxI3ACA.text: Ate at The Yard for the first time tonight and it definitely exceeded my expectations. The atmosphere inside the restaurant is very cool and welcoming. My friend and I were sat at a high top table in the bar area which was very nice in my option. The Yard is famous for their grilled cheese, so of course I felt obligated to order one. I ended up going with the Wang Chung Tonight, a grilled cheese made with Gouda, pulled BBQ chicken, and an Asian slaw. The sandwich was absolutely delicious! The barbecue sauce was sweet and tangy but not overpowering, all the sandwich ingredients definitely shined in their own way which was awesome. All grilled cheeses are served with a cup of their homemade tomato soup, which was delicious in my opinion. It was thick, creamy, and very flavorful. They also let you choose between four or five different types of French fries. I chose garlic parm fries while my friend had the sweet potato fries....both were very yummy. Although I didn't have a drink, they have an extensive beer list and next time I visit i definitely plan on trying out one of their IPAs! Would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cjl5ppcj8LvaYHxy6y-Y2Q.text: I was quite disappointed with this place. They have a great drink selection, a huge variety of options for lunch/dinner and a hip, casual atmosphere, but the food is just generic and has no taste. I got a house made chickpea basil burger that looked amazing but it was just tasteless and pastey. My boyfriend got a steak grilled cheese and said it tasted like nothing but butter and hot sauce. They have garlic Parm fries that they just drown in powdered cheese and dried parsley. This was my second attempt after being unimpressed with a tomato mozzarella grilled cheese. I feel like they could have grilled it longer because the inside of the sandwich was still cold and I would have liked the bread to be toasted more. It seems like they just let the sandwich sit on the grill for a few seconds.  The tomato soup is also subpar and tastes like Campbell's.  I go to a gastro pub expecting interesting food made in house and unfortunately this did not meet my standards.  I so terribly want to love this place but after the same experience with different food I will not be returning. I can effortlessly make a much better meal at home.

zfRgPGl-5-yiIAiCGZrXrA.text: First time at the Yard and loved it. Can't wait to go back. We went for brunch where I enjoy the bottomless mimosas. They are definitely worth it for the cost if you are going to drink more than 2. The chicken and waffles were Yummy. The portion was a little small but very filling. Our server was nice and attentive. Can't wait to go back and have one of the grilled cheeses.

XuFb79yf_Xbq6sd96sD0ow.text: Meh, I just was not a fan.  While the beer listing was extensive and I was able to try some things I've not seen elsewhere, little else impressed me. I had one of the grilled cheese listings from the menu.  Having stated that they get all their ingredients locally sourced and that their grilled cheese selections were their specialty, I was expecting so much more than the sad, boring sandwich I got.  Sorry.  Service and ambiance also quite meh.

CJ7fd1QrnbCcmFYb5xffOg.text: Both times me and friends have been here nothing but good experiences. Food was prepared in a fast pace manner and it was nothing but delicious. The beer selection was on point other than a couple being out of stock.. Bad side it is kind of loud in there but what do you expect with a packed house. Our waitress was great! So this is a must if you want to step out of your realm of normal dinners.

p_HhLYjKtpv3SkZpm3C9dw.text: Honestly, the food itself was very good but the service was absolutely appalling. Everything was wrong including our drinks, and it took absolutely forever to get our order...by the way the place was empty. Really sad because I don't know if I would go back even though I enjoyed the food.

uFcJJyKTmh8SAp6jE-_AaA.text: Great restaurant and atmosphere.  Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Food is reasonable and delicious

4MopEO5Dih7UtLI-dk8rrg.text: Improvement over last visit. I got afternoon delight..Swiss w turkey tomato, mayo. Yummy dipped and n tomato soup. Friend had simple jack , good but not the best she ever had. Tomato soup really good. Had beers, great as usual, service way better than before.

photos.caption: Photo of The Yard Gastropub - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Love those fries!!

bQA0I9uoPNqNMr7kmpa0PQ.text: I do love the food here!! However, we just had a bad experience with the staff.  We were told that there was a 45 minute wait on a Saturday night not crazy -but we could see empty high top tables.  We ran an errand nearby and booked a table on OpenTable for a time ten minutes in the future and went back. At this point the hostess told us she couldn't believe we did that and she didn't want to seat us. (Repeated multiple times) She said something about big parties and that we would have to wait for our food.  Which I understand is a concern for the kitchen and the wait staff but the attitude was not appreciated. I responded by saying I didn't want to eat somewhere that didn't want to seat me.  Had there been a better approach to that entire communication they would not have lost my business.

9jVR023Cvso3rmt-BTsF1Q.text: This is my favorite place for dinner in Pittsburgh!! I love the cheesey capresey grilled cheese!! The staff was very friendly and helped me make a good decision on what i wanted to order. I was stuck between a salad and grilled cheese, and after talking with the waitress she said that the restaurant was known for their grilled cheeses and that i wouldn't be disappointed. i was sure not disappointed at all!!

B3qrrqRFegxjiEgpWdyplg.text: I like to only refer to this place as "The Yard", because "Gastropub" makes me cringe a little bit.   If you've ever wondered what it's like to grab everything from your kitchen cabinet and throw it on to your grilled cheese.... look no further.  But in this case, you don't have to go through the trials and tribulations of finding the best (and, let's be honest, the worst) combinations.   The Yard chefs have already hand-picked taste-bud friendly "add-ons" for everyone's palates.   You won't go home hungry: grilled cheese + soup + chips leaves you full and satisfied.   I'm a big fan of the old bay chips.   Don't miss the BOGO grilled cheese on Monday nights

DR5SZHF5YN6ikKEbyVLIEw.text: I enjoyed the food here. Had the Yinz and it was really good. Shaved sirloin with mozz and provolone, fries and cole slaw just like a sandwich should be. Our server was really nice and attentive for being as busy as she was. Didn't have to wait long for anything. Fried Mac n cheese balls were super good!

hbiS27lkM3BWr9UEHrhRBg.text: Thank you David for your reply. I apologize for taking the bait on the twitter posting. I guess profanity these days can be taken in a positive and negative way. Not sure how we reached that point of confusion. I do look forward to stopping in for one of my favorite beers - Yuengling, the next time I am in town.

M4Dhriv-f1vk5-qPCH5HVg.text: Sooo yummy! Satisfied my grilled cheese craving. I got the Mother of Dragon(s) grilled cheese and loved it. The fact it had jalapenos adding crunchiness was mm mm gooood. It has a nice spiciness too because of the jalapenos and pepper jack. Basic tomato soup, it's not very "soupy" but a little on the thicker side, still yummy though. My only complaint would be that my chips were a little too seasoned so it was too salty for my tastebuds. Oh right, we came for their half off grilled cheese on Mondays (7pm-1am), which made it even better. Food: 5/5 Service 4/5

mQMxhtegEMy-FVsGYbov7A.text: From start to finish, this place was amazing.   I am new to Pittsburgh and was organizing a brunch for other girls new to the area. I noticed I couldn't make a reservation directly online, so I sent an email through their website. I was responded to within the hour by chuck, and he was so friendly and set us up with a reservation for that Saturday. Even when my reservation grew from 6 to 12, chuck was accommodating and friendly.   When we arrived at the restaurant, we were greeted by mike (mark?). Mike was friendly and got us set up with our table immediately. He even went so far as to sit down with our group for a minute and say hello and ask if we were celebrating anything. He noted we were all new from Pittsburgh, and took the time to ask where each of us were from.   Our server, Courtney, handled or large group flawlessly. She was prompt and friendly. Probably 75% of us ordered the bottomless mimosas, and not one of our glasses ever fell beyond half empty. The food was amazing and the portions were huuuuggggeeeee for the price.   We were all incredibly pleased, and will definitely be back soon. Thank you chuck, mike, and Courtney for making our large group experience amazing!!

Io2Pa_yYTysSJjK30q6BBA.text: We stopped here for brunch on a Sunday. We had a reservation but I am not sure we completely needed it. There was no one waiting at 11.   Food : the unique thing about this restaurant is the amount of difference grilled cheese sandwich options they have! Anything you can think of is put on a grilled cheese! Our whole table got one. We got the Mac attack, los pollos Hermanos, frank the tank and smack your mama ( yes all great names). All were delicious. They said the Mac attack was their best seller which is a Mac and cheese grilled cheese. All were very good though! We also got Mac and cheese bites as an appetizer . 6 come in it with a tasty chipotle mayo sauce for dipping. Each grilled cheese came with tasty tomato soup and house made chips!  Environment: nothing special or unique specifically about this restaurant. However there was nothing bad.   Service: Service was exceptional!

LBLesE_62fsYRZdSHStZeQ.text: You can't go wrong with the mac and cheese sandwich!  I loved the sides that came with it too, the best tomato soup I ever had!

bYq6dTwmR-gB_M6IyvC1sw.text: We are not fans of the new menu. The food is a little too cute, and lacking substance. They had some killer flatbreads once, but those are gone.  We brought a friend and were a little embarrassed. The music is still loud, not conducive to conversation.  We ordered the quiche, and it was just okay.   I'm not sure about the direction they are taking. The food is good, but the Yard is no longer one of our first choices.

xtWy1NOWb-W1ojiHA0_KZw.text: Get the mac and cheese! Whether you want the grilled cheese of it or the cup it is so good. Best mac and cheese I've had at a restaurant. Also this location has an upstairs bar with arcade games that are fun :)

INWclJNKsF10k4iSAxi18w.text: The hubby and I were in Shady Side to exchange something from Christmas and couldn't decide on a place for lunch. We chose The Yard because it was close to where we parked (and what we originally decided on was closed until 4) When we got inside they were busier than expected, I think the Bloody Mary bar was drawing everyone in! It was 11 am and the music was very loud, but it was nothing we couldn't tune out. We waited a while after we sat down before our waitress came over. She wasn't the friendliest but we just wanted a quick lunch so no huge deal. The waiter serving the next table was playing trivia with his table and it kept us entertained, as well.   He got: The Mike Byson Burger and chips. He enjoyed it but he asked for medium well and it came out still mooing? grunting? whatever Byson's do... however he still ate it and it filled him up.  I got: Holla Holla French Toast with Bananas. There were two huge pieces and it was good. Nothing spectacular but hey, french toast is french toast and it hit the spot.  Overall, it's probably no somewhere I would stop again, since there are so many other options in the area but the experience wasn't terrible either.
